entries: The wreckage of old furniture and decor suggests that this room once served as a drow priestess's sanctuary. Built into one wall is a massive, arched fireplace. The fireplace's 5-foot-wide chimney climbs vertically for 30 feet, then ends abruptly. The rest of it caved in long ago.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Characters who search the room and succeed on una tirada de Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) amb CD 20 find a secret compartment in the fireplace that contains a {@item potion of greater healing}.

entries.name: 11d. Southwest Palace Quarters
entries: This room is like {@area area 11c|58f|x} but contains no treasure.

{@b Mirror}. Mounted on the east wall is a tall rectangular mirror encased in an ornate stone frame with human skulls "woven" into it. This mirror is one of Halaster's gates (see "{@area Gates|028|x}").

{@b Wardrobe}. A tall, slender wardrobe made of purple wood stands against the south wall. (The wardrobe once contained ritual vestments, but they were stolen long ago. A search reveals nothing inside.)

entries.name: Mirror Gate to Level 12
entries: The mirror's stone frame is carved with twisting vines, woven into which are the actual skulls of eleven human adventurers killed in Undermountain. Carved into the bottom of the frame are the following words in Celestial: "The dead know the secret." The rules of the gate are as follows:

items: Speaking the proper paraula màgica ("Axallian") while standing in front of the mirror opens the gate durant 1 minut.

Characters must be 12th level or higher to pass through this gate (see "{@area Jhesiyra Kestellharp|016|x}"). The first creature to pass through the gate triggers an elder rune (see "{@area Elder Runes|027|x}").
A creature that passes through the gate appears in {@area area 6b on level 12|657|x}, in the closest unoccupied space next to the identical gate located there.

entries: Casting {@spell parlar amb els morts} on one of the skulls forces it to reveal the gate's paraula màgica, which Halaster changes every few days. The skulls are otherwise hostile and refuse to answer questions put to them.

entries.name: 11f. Pany Arcàed Doors
entries: Muiral has cast an {@spell pany arcà} spell on these doors, beyond which a stone staircase descends to {@area area 30b|5ef|x}. The characters can force open the doors with a successful DC 25 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check, but doing so alerts the drow in {@area area 30b|5ef|x}.

entries.name: 11g. Southeast Palace Quarters
entries: This room resembles {@area area 11c|58f|x}, except that the fireplace chimney is intact. The chimney has abundant handholds and can be climbed easily. After 90 feet, it opens into a damp, soot-stained natural cave roughly 30 feet wide by 60 feet long. Buried under the soot in a corner of the cave is a swollen wooden chest.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: The chest is unlocked, but its lid is stuck and must be pried open with a crowbar or similar tool. A character can also smash the chest's soft lid una tirada de Força (CD 9). The chest contains 120 pp, a set of thieves' tools wrapped in lizard hide, and a stoppered gourd containing {@item oil of slipperiness}.

entries.name: 11h. Northeast Palace Quarters
entries: This room is like {@area area 11c|58f|x} but contains no treasure.

entries.name: 12. Ballroom

entries: {@b Pillars and Ceiling}. Ten pillars carved with friezes of drow warriors support the 50-foot-high arched ceiling, which is engraved with web-like patterns. Two pillars have toppled at the far end of the hall.
{@b Monsters}. Two of Muiral's arcane experiments (see below) huddle next to the rubble of the toppled pillars.
{@b Floor}. Dusty black marble tiles cover the floor, many of them cracked and broken.

Muiral injected two drow prisoners with magic elixirs that forever transformed them into hideously deformed giants with bulging muscles, charcoal-black skin, and long, dirty-white hair. Mhavra and Naldath stand 24 feet tall, their limbs ill proportioned and their backs hunched. Their eyes gleam, hateful and red.

The giants' {@sense visió de foscor} allows them to see almost the entire length of the hall, and they hurl rocks (chunks of toppled pillars) at any intruders they can see. If the rocks don't get the job done, the giants smash foes with wrought iron chandeliers that they wield like estel de l'albas.
The mutated drow use the {@creature cloud giant} statistics, with these changes:

items: They are neutral evil.

They have the following racial traits: They speak Èlfic and Undercommon. They have {@sense visió de foscor} out to a range of 120 feet. They have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition fascinat}, and them no pot ésser adormit màgicament. While in sunlight, they have disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as a tirades d'habilitat de Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) que involucrin la vista.
Replace the cloud giant's spells with the following: {@spell llums dansaires} at will, and {@spell darkness} i {@spell foc follet} (save DC 15) each once per day.

entries.name: 13. Vestibule

entries: {@b Webs}. A 10-foot-thick mass of sticky webs conceals the 30-foot-high ceiling. Three {@creature Phase Spider||phase spiders} lurk in the lightly obscured area amid the webs.
{@b Guards}. Four male {@creature drow} stand guard in the room, two flanking each double door.
The drow are named Hlonlok, Izzorvir, Nephraen, and Sornnozz. They have orders to kill intruders on sight, and the phase spiders follow their lead.

Sornnozz has betrayed his kin by choosing to serve Xarann A'Daragon, a House Freth spy who has infiltrated Muiral's Gauntlet. When combat erupts, Sornnozz switches sides and helps the characters kill the phase spiders and the other guards. He then offers to lead the characters to Xarann in {@area area 17d|5b2|x}. If pressed for details, Sornnozz claims that Xarann is looking for ways to weaken House Auvryndar's hold over Muiral's Gauntlet, and he thinks a band of adventurers might be the answer to Xarann's prayers.

entries.name: 14. Guest Apartment
entries: Vlonwelv maintains these quarters for guests.

entries.name: 14a. Dining Room
entries: If Vlonwelv is still alive, the characters hear her disembodied voice when they enter this chamber for the first time (see "{@area Vlonwelv's Pulpit|562|x}").
{@b Chandelier}. The room has a 30-foot-high flat ceiling, hanging from which is a wrought iron chandelier shaped vaguely like a giant spider and anchored to the ceiling by a chain.

{@b Furnishings}. Beneath the chandelier lies an elongated, oval dining table with a slate top and spider-like iron legs. Eight cushioned iron chairs surround it. An ornate wooden cabinet stands against the north wall.
{@b Fresco}. A large fresco of an elven city covers the south wall.
Before the drow were driven underground and into Lolth's evil embrace, they lived in cities on the surface alongside their elf kin. The fresco on the south wall depicts one of these ancient cities.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: The cabinet contains a 10-pound box of silver flatware (250 gp) and a silver snuffbox (25 gp).
{@b Fireplace}. A massive fireplace dominates the east wall. (The fireplace's 5-foot-wide chimney climbs vertically for 50 feet, then ends abruptly. The rest of it caved in long ago.)
{@b Furnishings}. Six stuffed chairs and a chaise longue are arranged near the fireplace.

entries.name: 14c. Study

entries: {@b Furnishings}. An elegant zurkhwood desk stands in the middle of the room, a thin matching chair positioned behind it.
{@b Bookshelves}. Carved into the west, south, and east walls are rows of bookshelves. Five books rest on one of the southern shelves; all the other shelves are bare.

Two of the five books are blank. The others include {@i Matrons of the Sunless Depths} (a treatise on the importance of the drow matriarchy, written in Èlfic by Vlonwelv Auvryndar), {@i The Poison Chalice} (a fictional tale of political intrigue in the city of Menzoberranzan, written in Èlfic by an unknown author), and {@i Demonic Infestations} (a collection of stories about demonic possession, written in Common). None of the books are especially valuable.

entries.name: 14d. Mirror Gate to Level 7

entries: {@b Bed}. A zurkhwood bed draped by a spider silk canopy stands against the north wall.
{@b Mirror}. A tall, rectangular mirror is mounted on the east wall. The mirror is one of Halaster's magic gates (see "{@area Gates|028|x}").
Etched into the bottom of the mirror's stone frame are the letters T-U-O-Y-A-W (a reflection of W-A-Y-O-U-T). This gate's rules are as follows:

items: If a creature speaks the words "Way out!" while pointing at the mirror, the gate opens durant 1 minut.

Characters must be 9th level or higher to pass through this gate (see "{@area Jhesiyra Kestellharp|016|x}"). The first creature to pass through the gate triggers an elder rune (see "{@area Elder Runes|027|x}").
A creature that passes through the gate appears in {@area area 41 on level 7|439|x}, in the closest unoccupied space next to the identical gate located there.

entries.name: 15. Screaming Skulls

entries: {@b Collapse}. The eastern branch of this hallway has collapsed. A search of the rubble yields nothing of value.
{@b Skulls}. The western branch contains six large piles of drow skulls (each marked with an X on map 10).

Muiral collected the skulls long ago, and the drow have chosen not to disturb them. A creature that approaches within 5 feet of a pile can hear faint, dying screams emanating from the skulls. A skull removed from a pile falls silent.

entries.name: 16. False Mirror Gate

entries: {@b Mirror}. Mounted to the north wall above a rectangular dais is a 6-foot-tall oval mirror set in a stone frame carved to look like Halaster's yawning face, the mirror forming his wide-open mouth.
{@b Dais}. Etched on the floor of the dais are the words "Flattery will get you everywhere."

{@b Statues}. Flanking the dais are two {@condition petrificat} {@creature Hook Horror||hook horrors} that look like carved statues. (The hook horrors pose no danger in their current state. Casting a {@spell restabliment superior} spell or similar magic on one restores it to flesh and blood, whereupon it attacks.)
The mirror looks like one of Halaster's magic gates and functions similarly (see "{@area Gates|028|x}"). Its rules are as follows:

items: If a creature stands atop the dais and says something flattering about Halaster, the mirror vanishes, revealing a dusty corridor beyond that leads off into darkness. This corridor is an illusion.

Any creature that steps through the mirror is teleported, along with all its worn and carried items, to the top of the 60-foot shaft in {@area area 22a|5c5|x}, whereupon the creature falls and takes 21 ({@dice 6d6}) de dany contundent on impact.

The first creature to fall for the trap triggers a {@spell boca màgica} spell in {@area area 22a|5c5|x}. Halaster's mouth appears on a wall and says, in Common, "You fell for it! Get it? Fell for it?! Ha ha ha ha!"

entries.name: 17. The Dark Seldarine
entries: These temples are dedicated to the Dark Seldarine, a pantheon of drow gods under Lolth. Each room has walls that rise 15 feet, then angle inward to a central point 30 feet above the middle of the floor.

entries.name: 17a. Temple of Ghaunadaur
entries: Ghaunadaur, a god of subterranean horrors, is respected and feared by many Underdark races, including drow. This temple contains the following features:

{@b Green Slime}. Each 10-foot-wide, 15-foot-high section of vertical wall is covered with six 5-foot-square patches of green slime (see "{@book Dungeon Hazards|DMG|5|Dungeon Hazards}" in chapter 5 of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}).

{@b Secret Door}. The slime obscures a secret door. Ability checks made to search the walls for secret doors are made with disadvantage until the slime is scraped off the section of wall in which the secret door is hidden.
{@b Altar}. What appears at first viewing to be a glistening altar of variegated gray stone is, in fact, a hollow glass altar with three psychic {@creature Gray Ooze||gray oozes} sealed inside it.
The glass altar is a Large object with AC 11, 55 hit points, immunity to damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine, and immunity to acid, poison, and psychic damage.

The gray oozes attack all creatures that enter the room using their Psychic Crush action option (see the "Variant: Psychic Gray Oozes" sidebar in the "Oozes" entry in the {@book Monster Manual|MM}). While contained in the altar, the oozes have total cover, their speed is 0 feet, and they can't attack with their pseudòpodes.

entries.name: 17b. Temple of Kiaransalee
entries: This temple of Kiaransalee, drow god of undeath, reeks of decay and contains the following:
{@b Altar}. An altar made of humanoid skulls and bones rests near the south wall.
{@b Decor and Secret Door}. Embedded in the walls are drow skeletons posed as if dancing. One skeleton along the south wall is missing its head (behind it is a secret door that won't budge).
Only an undead creature or a creature possessed by one can open this secret door without the aid of a {@spell picaporta} spell or similar magic.

If a character kneels before the altar and offers a prayer to Kiaransalee, or leaves a respectful offering on the altar, the room grows markedly colder as the silent {@creature ghost} of a drow priestess materializes next to the altar and tries to possess the nearest humanoid creature. If it succeeds, the ghost uses its host to open the secret door, then releases its host and shifts into the Pla Etèri. An oath of service binds the ghost to the temple for as long as it stands. The ghost is unaligned and fights only in self-defense. If reduced to 0 hit points, the ghost is destroyed for 24 hours, then re-forms.

entries.name: 17c. Temple of Selvetarm
entries: The temple of Selvetarm, drow god of warriors, contains the following features:
{@b Blood}. Streaks of dry blood form web-like patterns on the walls and floor.
{@b Altar}. A wrought iron altar has a bloody indentation of a right hand atop it. A nonmagical shortsword floats a foot above, its bloodstained blade pointed downward.
{@b Secret Door}. A secret door hidden in the south wall requires a blood sacrifice to open (see below).

The altar refuses to budge. A {@spell detectar màgia} spell reveals an aura of transmutation magic around and above it. Any object weighing 10 pounds or less that is left unattended atop the altar rises until it is levitating 1 foot above the surface. This levitation field can't be dispelled but is suppressed in an camp antimàgic.

If a humanoid presses its cut hand (even a superficial wound will do) into the altar's hand-shaped indentation, the secret door in the south wall swings open. A {@spell picaporta} spell or similar magic also opens the door.

entries.name: 17d. Temple of Vhaeraun
entries: This temple of Vhaeraun, drow god of thieves and assassins, contains the following features:
{@b Assassin's Altar}. An altar of blood-red stone stands near the south wall. Xarann A'Daragon, a male drow assassin, prays silently before it.
{@b Curtains}. Three black curtains hang from iron hooks along the west, south, and east walls.
{@b Secret Door}. A secret door hidden in the wall behind the south curtain opens only when certain conditions are met (see below).

A character who examines a curtain and succeeds on una tirada de Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) amb CD 19 notices the slightly darker silhouette of a drow sewn into it. If the characters find the silhouette in one curtain, they gain advantage on checks made to spot the silhouette hidden in each of the other two curtains. Each silhouette makes a sign with one of its hands; drow characters recognize these hand-signs that, collectively, spell out the Èlfic phrase {@i oloth elgg ssussun}, which translates to "darkness slays light." If a creature makes these hand-signs in the proper order anywhere in the room, the secret door in the south wall swings open. A {@spell picaporta} spell or similar magic also opens the door.

entries.name: Xarann A'Daragon
entries: Xarann, a spy for House Freth, is posing as a House Auvryndar assassin. He came here to pray to Vhaeraun before setting out on two missions: the rescue of Tazirahc Oussar (see {@area area 19|5bd|x}) and the assassination of Vlonwelv Auvryndar.

Xarann is initially friendly toward the characters. In exchange for their help killing the guards in {@area area 18b|5ba|x} and rescuing Tazirahc in {@area area 19|5bd|x}, Xarann will show them the way to {@adventure level 11|WDMM|11}. If they agree to help kill Vlonwelv, Xarann will show them where the drow priestess keeps her treasure ({@area area 27b|5de|x}) and lead them through back tunnels ({@area area 24b|5cc|x}) to get there. Once Xarann's missions are complete, he tries to eliminate the characters, choosing a moment when they appear weakest to betray them. Sornnozz (see {@area area 13|59b|x}) and Tazirahc are loyal to Xarann and follow his lead.
Xarann is a drow {@creature assassin}, with these changes:

items: Xarann is neutral evil.

He has these racial traits: He speaks Èlfic and Undercommon. Té avantatge a salvar contra la condició {@condition fascinat} i no pot patir son màgicament He has {@sense visió de foscor} out to a range of 120 feet. He can innately cast {@spell llums dansaires} at-will, and {@spell darkness}, {@spell foc follet}, i {@spell levitar} (self only) each once per day. His habilitat de llançament de conjurs is Carisma (spell save DC 11). he té desavantatge quan li toca llum solar, as well as a tirades d'habilitat de Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) que involucrin la vista.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Xarann wears a {@i piwafwi}, a drow-made {@item cloak of elvenkind}. It loses its magic if exposed to sunlight durant 1 hora without interruption. Pinned to this cloak is an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Auvryndar. Xarann has a similar scarab, this one engraved with the symbol of House Freth, tucked in his belt. Each scarab is worth 25 gp.

entries.name: 17e. Temple of Eilistraee
entries: This temple of Eilistraee, god of beauty, dance, and the hunt, features the following:
{@b Music}. A hymn magically plays throughout the temple.
{@b Secret Door}. A secret door in the south wall opens only when the name of the hymn is spoken aloud.

{@b Altar}. A beautifully carved stone altar supports a harp-shaped sculpture. Worked into the harp's design is a female elf carved to look like she is leaping into the air, carefree, with her head and arms thrown back.
Examination of the altar reveals Èlfic runes worked into the harp. Any character who understands Èlfic can translate the words as "The hymn is the key."

A character who succeeds on una tirada d'Intel·ligència ({@skill Religió}) amb CD 20 recognizes the hymn as "Bwaelan Dro," or "It's Good to Be Alive," an elven song of celebration. Elves and semi-elfs have advantage on this check. If the hymn's name is spoken aloud anywhere in the temple, in either Common or Èlfic, the secret door in the south wall swings open. A {@spell picaporta} spell or similar magic also opens the secret door.

entries.name: 18. First Blood
entries: If the characters have forged an alliance with Xarann A'Daragon (see {@area area 17d|5b2|x}), he goes on ahead of them and distracts the drow in {@area area 18b|5ba|x}, allowing the characters to gain surprise.

entries.name: 18a. Voices
entries: Characters who enter this hall hear sounds of yelling and cheering from {@area area 18b|5ba|x} to the east. If Vlonwelv is still alive, the characters also hear her disembodied voice as they make their way down this hallway for the first time (see "{@area Vlonwelv's Pulpit|562|x}").
Alcoves along the north wall have secret doors set into the backs of them. These doors pull open easily from this side, revealing {@area areas 17a|5ac|x} through {@area 17e|5b6} beyond.

entries.name: 18b. Fight Club

entries: {@b Drow}. In the middle of the room, a female {@creature drow elite warrior} named Drinrith Auvryndar (Vlonwelv's niece) is providing melee combat training to fourteen smaller, weaker male {@creature drow}, each one with 6 hit points remaining.

{@b Fresco and Spiders}. The eastern wall bears a cracked fresco of a drow city in the Underdark. Clinging to this wall are four {@creature Giant Spider||giant spiders} that serve as Drinrith's bodyguards.
{@b Wreckage}. Wrecked furniture lies piled in the southeast corner. Rubble chokes a great fireplace in the north wall.

Thirteen of the male drow are standing in a circle around Drinrith and the fourteenth male drow, who are engaged in a duel. When Drinrith draws blood or knocks the male to the ground, she either replaces him with a new challenger or orders two other males to fight one another while she barks criticism.

If the characters allow Xarann A'Daragon to distract the room's occupants, he challenges Drinrith to a one-on-one fight. Drinrith accepts the challenge, prompting the males to shout cheers and jibes during the protracted battle and granting the characters advantage on Destresa ({@skill Sigil}) checks made to surprise the drow and the giant spiders while the contest rages.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Drinrith wears an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Auvryndar (25 gp) and a platinum-inlaid helm of black metal molded in the likeness of a spider with carnelians for eyes (750 gp).

entries.name: 19. Interrogation Room
entries: Characters who listen at the double door hear tortured screams coming from beyond. Once used as a kitchen, this 20-foot-high room has been mostly cleaned out.

{@b Interrogation}. A male {@creature drow mage} named Kereth Ichorzza and a summoned {@creature quasit} are interrogating a male {@creature drow} named Tazirahc Oussar, who is bound to an iron chair with spider silk.
{@b Observers}. Observing the interrogation are two male {@creature Drow Elite Warrior||drow elite warriors} named Gelgos Argonrae and Jevan Kron'tayne.

When not serving as the consort of Drinrith Auvryndar (see {@area area 18b|5ba|x}), Kereth is tasked with interrogating drow accused of being House Freth spies. The quasit has already used its Scare action option on Tazirahc, and Kereth is preparing to zap the prisoner with a {@spell ray of frost} cantrip, hoping he'll divulge the identities of other House Freth spies in their midst.

The drow attack characters who interfere in the interrogation. Once Kereth and his cronies are dealt with, characters can cut through Tazirahc's bonds and release him if they so desire. If Xarann A'Daragon (see {@area area 17d|5b2|x}) is with the party, he questions Tazirahc to make sure he didn't divulge any compromising information. If the characters haven't met Xarann yet, Tazirahc is determined to find him once he is released. Tazirahc rewards his liberators by sharing one Undermountain secret with them; draw a card from the Secrets Deck (see {@adventure appendix C|WDMM|27}) to determine what Tazirahc knows.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Kereth, Gelgos, and Jevan each carry an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Auvryndar (25 gp). Kereth also carries a zurkhwood wand (his arcane focus) and a leather-bound spellbook containing all the spells he has prepared.

entries.name: 20. Servants' Quarters
entries: This large room once housed servants. It now contains the web-shrouded wreckage of several beds and dressers. A fireplace on the east wall is choked with rubble.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: If the characters search the rubble-filled fireplace, they find a half-burned wooden scroll tube containing a {@item spell pergamí} of {@spell immobilitzar humanoide}.
{@b Webs}. Thick webs fill the corners, shroud the ceiling, and smother the rotted remains of old furnishings.

{@b Spiders and Eggs}. Four {@creature Giant Spider||giant spiders} guard a large cluster of twenty giant spider eggs in the northeast corner. Half of the eggs are empty sacs left behind by spiders that have already hatched. (If left alone, the remaining eggs here will hatch in a few days.)

entries.name: 22. Troglodita Turf
entries: Drow avoid these areas because they smell terrible.

entries.name: 22a. Shaft
entries: This 60-foot-high, 20-foot-wide stone shaft is nestled between two secret doors, one of which pulls open to reveal a stinking, filthy troglodita den ({@area area 22b|5c6|x}). The other door opens into a hallway. Characters who fall for Halaster's trap in {@area area 16|5a9|x} end up here.

entries.name: 22b. Troglodita Den
entries: Trogloditas use this filthy room as a den. The room is unoccupied when the characters first arrive.
{@b Refuse}. The floor is strewn with gnawed bones, smashed furniture, and other refuse.
{@b Gorzil's Throne}. Against the west wall is a throne made of garbage with treasure heaped around it.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Gorzil's hoard includes 500 cp, 350 sp, 60 gp, a kit de sanació, four torches, a rotted quiver containing seven silvered arrows, and a {@item poció de curació} in a crystal vial with a spider-shaped stopper.

entries.name: 23. Distant Music
entries: This 30-foot-wide hallway has a 45-foot-high arched ceiling carved with spiders and webs. Band music can be heard coming from a large chamber to the west (see {@area area 25|5ce|x}). The east end of the hall has collapsed, and a secret door in the north wall pushes open to reveal a hallway that leads to {@area areas 21|5c2|x} and {@area 18b|5ba}.

entries.name: 24. Collapsed Areas
entries: A tremor caused a collapse in this section of the dungeon, wrecking two rooms ({@area areas 24a|5cb|x} and {@area 24c|5cd}) and creating a small maze of tunnels ({@area area 24b|5cc|x}).

entries.name: 24a. Guard Post
entries: A foul stench wafts through the double door, which stands ajar. This partially collapsed room is empty except for piles of rubble and six {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas} wielding longswords and wearing breastplates (see "{@area Gorzil's Gang|55a|x}"). The trogloditas attack anything that isn't a troglodita or a drow. If the adventuring party includes one or more drow characters or NPCs, the trogloditas bow their heads and wait for new orders, obeying any command from a drow that isn't clearly suicidal.

entries.name: 24b. Tunnels
entries: These naturally formed tunnels wind through collapsed rooms and hallways. The walls are composed of jagged stones, and the floor throughout is silty and wet.

entries.name: 24c. Morgue
entries: A foul stench wafts through the double door, which stands ajar. Piled near the tunnels at the back of the room are the stripped corpses of eight drow and sixteen trogloditas in varying stages of decay. Feasting on the remains are seven drow {@creature Ghoul||ghouls} that were created by Vlonwelv to devour the dead. The ghouls retreat into the back tunnels when one or more drow enter the room. If a drow is not among those who enter, the ghouls attack.

entries.name: 25. Auvryndar Hall
entries: This hall was once a market where the drow kept and sold slaves. It now serves as House Auvryndar's main military stronghold in Undermountain. If Vlonwelv Auvryndar is here, the drow priestess is seated on the throne in the southern alcove ({@area area 25b|5d1|x}), listening to tedious reports of the battles waging against House Freth.

entries.name: 25a. Hall of the Dark Seldarine
entries: Any character who tries to sneak into this room must succeed on una tirada de Destresa ({@skill Sigil}) amb CD 13, made with disadvantage due to the large number of guards.

{@b Fountain}. The centerpiece of this immense, 80-foot-high room is a 60-foot-diameter fountain adorned with eight statues that represent the Dark Seldarine (the drow pantheon). Cracked tiles fanning out from the fountain form a web-like mosaic on the floor.
{@b Guards}. Fifteen {@creature drow} guards are scattered throughout the room. They defend this chamber to the death.

{@b Giant Lizards}. Two {@creature Giant Lizard||giant lizards} fitted with saddles, reins, and stirrups are parked in the southeast corner. These docile reptiles are used as mounts by the drow scouts in {@area area 25b|5d1|x} and have the Spider Climb trait (see the "Variant: Giant Lizard Traits" sidebar in appendix A of the {@book Monster Manual|MM}).
{@b Slave Pen}. A stone enclosure in the northwest corner serves as a slave pen. Band music emanates from within.

The fountain is fed by a natural spring and provides the drow with a virtually endless supply of fresh water. The statues stand atop stone plinths above the water, facing outward. Starting with the northernmost one and moving clockwise, the statues represent Eilistraee (god of beauty, dance, and the hunt), Malyk (god of wild magic), Kiaransalee (god of undeath), Ghaunadaur (god of oozes, slimes, and all things subterranean), Zinzerena (god of assassins), Vhaeraun (god of thieves), Lolth (the Demon Queen of Spiders and mother of the Dark Seldarine) in her drow form, and Selvetarm (god of war and warriors).

This 40-foot-square slave pen has 20-foot-high walls of smooth stone. Instead of a roof, it has a 5-foot-thick covering of sticky webs. The webs provide an effective barrier, and any creature that enters the webs or starts its turn in them is {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature can use its action to try to pull itself out of the webs, doing so with a successful DC 12 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) or Destresa ({@skill Acrobàcies}) check. Each 10-foot-square section of webs has AC 10, 10 hit points, vulnerability to fire, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and psychic damage.

A sturdy iron-barred gate set into the east wall is held shut with an {@spell pany arcà} spell that only drow can ignore. Forcing the gate open requires a successful DC 25 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check.

The slave pen is lined with straw. It contains a halfling musical quintet that the drow kidnapped just outside the town of Daggerford. The performers call themselves the Sing-Alongs, and they're quite good. Vlonwelv makes sure that they're fed and treated well; in exchange, they fill her hall with music. The members and their instruments are Peeta Brightmoon (drum), Kevin Gladriver (fiddle), Philomena Gladriver (viol), Olivia Tallrush (horn), and Shardon Underbough (flute). They are strongheart halfling {@creature Commoner||commoners}, with these changes:

items: The Sing-Alongs are lawful good.
Each has a Carisma of 14 and the following skill: {@skill Performance} +4.

They have these racial traits: They speak, read, and write Common and Halfling. They are Small, and their walking speed is 25 feet. They have advantage on saving throws against poison and against being {@condition acovardit}, and they have resistance to poison damage. They can move through the space of any creature larger than they are.

entries: Although the halfling musicians are grateful for the kind treatment of their drow captors, they have grown weak from eating nothing but mushrooms and would like to return to the surface. They have little hope of reaching Waterdeep on their own and would appreciate an escort. Getting all five band members to the Yawning Portal alive completes this quest. Durnan is pleased to have the halflings perform for his patrons and rewards the characters with a round of drinks. If the heroes plan to return to Undermountain, Durnan also pulls a few strings to secure a {@item potion of superior healing} for each of them.

entries.name: 25b. Spider Throne

entries: {@b Throne}. This large alcove contains a spider-shaped throne. A red crystal orb is set into a fixture at the end of one armrest.
{@b Mirror}. Mounted to the east wall is a tall, rectangular mirror with an ornate stone frame. The mirror is one of Halaster's gates (see "{@area Gates|028|x}").

If Vlonwelv is here, the {@creature drow priestess of Lolth} is seated on the throne, flanked by her drow champion, Zress (see "{@area Zress Orlezziir|558|x}") and a {@creature yochlol} advisor that has assumed the form of a female drow wearing a spider silk robe with a cowl. Kneeling before the priestess are two male {@creature drow} scouts named Llossul and Yuinfein, who have recently returned from a reconnaissance mission on level 11. If Vlonwelv isn't present, Llossul and Yuinfein are here waiting for her to return.

The throne is a Large object with AC 18, 80 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. A {@spell detectar màgia} spell reveals an aura of abjuration magic around the throne itself and a separate aura of evocation magic around the throne's red crystal orb.

Any creature other than an elf that sits on the throne or starts its turn there ha de salvar per Constitució (CD 13), taking 22 ({@dice 4d10}) de dany de verí; si supera, en rep la meitat. A creature seated on the throne and touching the orb can use a bonus action to broadcast its voice to every location in Muiral's Gauntlet. The orb loses its magic if it is torn free of the throne, or if the throne is destroyed.

entries.name: Mirror Gate to Level 8
entries: The mirror's frame is composed of an assemblage of hundreds of tiny, interlocking stone gears. The rules of this gate are as follows:

items: Any creature that inspects the frame and succeeds on una tirada de Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) amb CD 15 sees that one of the gears has popped out slightly. If it is pressed, the gear locks in place, causing all the gears to turn and the gate to open durant 1 minut. When the gate closes, a different random gear pops out slightly, causing all the gears to lock again.

Characters must be 10th level or higher to pass through this gate (see "{@area Jhesiyra Kestellharp|016|x}"). The first creature to pass through the gate triggers an elder rune (see "{@area Elder Runes|027|x}").
A creature that passes through the gate appears in {@area area 17c on level 8|46e|x}, in the closest unoccupied space next to the identical gate located there.

entries.name: 25c. Entrance

entries: {@b Stairs}. Stairs carved out of a stone ramp descend 40 feet to the floor of a vast natural cavern ({@area area 30|5ec|x}).

{@b Guards}. Standing guard at the top of the stairs, facing westward, are two male {@creature Drow Mage||drow mages} named Gorthax Auvryndar (Vlonwelv's nephew) and Syrrak Argonrae. Positioned behind them, in the middle of the hall, is a transparent, 15-foot-diameter crystal spider (use {@creature stone gòlem} statistics).

The mages aren't expecting attacks from the east. If combat erupts in {@area area 25a|5cf|x} or {@area 25b|5d1}, Syrrak investigates while Gorthax and the crystal spider remain here. A battle in this hall brings reinforcements from {@area area 30a|5ed|x}.
The spider gòlem understands Èlfic but can't speak. It obeys Gorthax's commands.

entries.name: 26. Spider Queen's Temple
entries: Years of neglect have left this temple in a terrible state. Work has begun to repair the damage.

entries.name: Web Curtain
entries: A web curtain separates a 50-foot-high arched narthex to the north from the temple to the south. The curtain blocks line of sight and catches any ammunition shot into it. If set on fire, it burns away quickly.

entries.name: Temple Nave
entries: If Vlonwelv is here, the {@creature drow priestess of Lolth} is standing in the middle of the nave, supervising its reconstruction. She is accompanied by her bodyguard, Zress (see "{@area Zress Orlezziir|558|x}") and her {@creature yochlol} advisor, which has assumed the form of a giant spider.
Whether Vlonwelv and her entourage are here or not, the temple nave contains the following features:

{@b Decor}. Six cracked pillars carved with intertwining demons stretch to a 50-foot-high ceiling braced by thick arches. The cracked walls are carved with damaged carvings of demons and enormous spiders.

{@b Webwork}. A giant spiderweb forms a false ceiling 40 feet above the floor. Throughout the room, in and atop this sturdy web, climb seven {@creature Giant Spider||giant spiders}. Hanging from the spiders at various heights are seven male {@creature drow} masons on spider silk swings. The spiders and drow form a work crew.
{@b Statue}. An alcove in the middle of the west wall houses a 20-foot-tall, corroded iron statue of Lolth in her female drow form, garbed in countless spiders.

In place of scaffolding, the drow workers here use web lines and swings to get at hard-to-reach places. The giant spiders manipulate these webs to move the drow workers wherever they want to go. In addition to the other spells they can cast innately, the drow workers are blessed by Lolth with the ability to cast the {@spell apedaçar} cantrip at will, and they use their magic to repair small cracks and broken stonework. If they notice intruders, the drow stop their work and attack with their hand crossbows. Each worker is suspended {@dice 2d4 × 5} feet off the ground.

entries.name: 27. Vlonwelv's Apartments
entries: No one may enter these chambers without the consent of Vlonwelv Auvryndar. The punishment for violating her chambers is death.

entries.name: 27a. Council Room and Parlor
entries: This area consists of two chambers connected by a short, 10-foot-high hallway. Vlonwelv meets with her captains in the council room to the west and entertains guests in the parlor to the east.

If Vlonwelv is here, the {@creature drow priestess of Lolth} is relaxing in her parlor while receiving counsel from her {@creature yochlol} advisor, which appears in its natural form. Standing near Vlonwelv is her champion, Zress (see "{@area Zress Orlezziir|558|x}").

entries.name: Council Room
entries: The room to the west contains a large spider-shaped table of sculpted stone. No chairs are present, since Vlonwelv expects her captains to stand as they deliver their briefings.

entries.name: Parlor
entries: The room to the east smells of incense. It contains two male {@creature drow} attendants named Sharaun and Tarzyr; they're armed but unarmored (AC 12). These young drow dote on Vlonwelv when she's present.

The parlor is furnished with overstuffed chairs, cushioned divans, bronze braziers containing smoldering incense, a glass cabinet stocked with elven wines and crystal goblets, and crystal sculptures of demons.
{@b Mosaic}. The north wall is covered with a tarnished bronze mosaic depicting Lolth's face, with silver, web-like tracery fanning out from it.
{@b Furnishings}. The room contains a spider-shaped bed carved out of zurkhwood, a matching wardrobe containing assorted garments, and an ancient stone font filled with fresh water.

entries.name: 27c. Giant Spider Den
entries: This 10-foot-high, web-filled chamber is home to three {@creature Giant Spider||giant spiders} that attack any non-drow who enter.

entries.name: 28. Hospital and Armory
entries: Drow in the service of House Auvryndar come here to equip themselves for battle and to have their wounds treated.

entries.name: 28a. Hospital
entries: This chamber contains two dozen wooden cots in rows. Resting in six of them are wounded {@creature drow} (three females and three males), each with {@dice 1d12} hit points remaining. They are still clad in armor, and they keep their weapons within arm's reach.

Tending to the injured are three junior priestesses of Lolth named Nyleene Auvryndar (Vlonwelv's grand-niece), Ereldra Abbath, and Llezorna Do'ett. These three are drow {@creature Priest||priests}, with these changes:

items: They are neutral evil.
Each has two 1st-level spell slots and no spell slots of higher level remaining.

They have these racial traits: They speak Èlfic and Undercommon. They have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition fascinat}, and them no pot ésser adormit màgicament. They have {@sense visió de foscor} out to a range of 120 feet. They can innately cast {@spell llums dansaires} at will, and {@spell darkness} i {@spell foc follet} each once per day. Their habilitat de llançament de conjurs is Carisma (spell save DC 11). While in sunlight, they have disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as a tirades d'habilitat de Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) que involucrin la vista.

entries: {@b Crates}. Crates stacked in the middle of the room contain sixty shortswords, one hundred hand crossbows, and thousands of bolts for the hand crossbows.
{@b Tunnel Entrance}. A gash in the north wall forms the entrance to a tunnel network (see {@area area 24b|5cc|x}).

entries.name: 29. Abandoned Apartment
entries: When various tunnels and rooms in the dungeon collapsed, these chambers were almost cut off. A narrow tunnel provides the only entrance. After the drow ran afoul of the wraith in {@area area 29b|5e7|x}, they decided not to explore these rooms further.

entries.name: 29a. Gallery
entries: Broken statuary litters this dust-choked gallery. Examination of the stone fragments accompanied by a successful Saviesa ({@skill Perspicàcia}) check reveals that the statues once depicted drow.

entries.name: 29b. Wraith This Way
entries: This room is deathly cold and contains the following:
{@b Undead}. A {@creature wraith} and three {@creature Specter||specters} haunt the room. They attack all living creatures that enter.
{@b Corpses}. Lying on the dusty floor amid pieces of broken furniture are three dead drow, their bodies shriveled.
{@b Fireplace}. A massive fireplace dominates the east wall. (Its 5-foot-wide chimney climbs vertically for 30 feet, then ends abruptly, having caved in long ago.)
{@b Portrait of Halaster}. Hanging crookedly above the fireplace is a 7-foot-tall, 5-foot-wide framed portrait showing the back of Halaster's head: a mass of gray hair (see "Painting Trap" below).
The wraith is all that remains of an evil adventurer who was disintegrated by Halaster in this room long ago. It speaks Common and Undercommon but doesn't have much to say to the living.

The wraith killed the three drow (two females and one male) and turned their spirits into specters. Each drow corpse wears a chain shirt, clutches a shortsword, and packs a hand crossbow with {@dice 1d20} bolts.

entries.name: Painting Trap
entries: A {@spell detectar màgia} spell reveals an aura of necromancy magic around the painting. If anyone straightens the picture or otherwise tampers with it, the image of Halaster magically turns, revealing a withered skull face wearing a grin so horrifying that any creature looking at it ha de salvar per Constitució (CD 15); si falla, the creature es queda a 0 punts de vida and is dying. After revealing its ghastly visage, the skull-faced Halaster then turns back around so that only its hair is visible once more. Once this trap triggers, the painting becomes nonmagical and harmless.

entries.name: 29c. Collapsed Tunnel
entries: This tunnel connected to {@area area 23|5c9|x} before trèmol de terras triggered a collapse. Characters who search the rubble at the end of the tunnel find a mostly buried dwarf skeleton with shiny gauntlets and a rusty martell de guerra.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: The dwarf was an adventurer who was killed when the ceiling collapsed on her over a hundred years ago. Her gauntlets have no dents and show no signs of corrosion. An {@spell identificar} spell or similar magic reveals that they are {@item gauntlets of ogre power}.

entries.name: 30. Natural Cavern
entries: House Auvryndar keeps a large force stationed here in case the forces of House Freth launch an attack from level 11. This cavern provides most of the food that sustains House Auvryndar's troops, making it vital to the house's survival in Undermountain.
The main cavern ({@area area 30a|5ed|x}) has a 40-foot-high ledge to the north ({@area area 30b|5ef|x}) with a secret staircase connecting them.

entries.name: 30a. Main Cavern

entries: {@b Roof}. The cavern's roof is 80 feet high and festooned with dripping stalactites.

{@b Monsters}. Patrolling the cavern are four {@creature Drow Elite Warrior||drow elite warriors} (two females named Mizreen Abbath and Shynzal Tlin'orzza, and two males named K'yorl Tanor'thal and Rross Hylarn) mounted on {@creature Giant Lizard||giant lizards}, five giant flying spiders (see below), and eight {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas} split into two groups of four.

{@b River}. Water pours in from the south, feeding a swift river that winds northwest for several hundred yards before plunging into the Underdark. The river is 5 feet deep but deepens to 10 feet as it exits the cavern. Fungi and moss grow on both riverbanks.
{@b Fungi}. The soft, peaty floor gives rise to a fungi forest that includes 40-foot-tall zurkhwood mushrooms (as well as the occasional stump).

The drow treat their lizard mounts as prized pets. These docile reptiles have saddles, reins, stirrups, motxilles de sella, and the Spider Climb trait (see the "Variant: Giant Lizard Traits" sidebar in appendix A of the {@book Monster Manual|MM}).
The flying spiders are {@creature Giant Spider||giant spiders} that have wings and una velocitat de vol de 40 peus. They zip around the cavern and build web nests in the caps of zurkhwood mushrooms.

The drow cut down zurkhwood when they need to build furniture or rafts, while gardens of barrelstalk and trillimac provide food, water, and parchment (see "{@area Fungi|236|x}" for more information on barrelstalk, trillimac, and zurkhwood).
The stinky trogloditas answer to Gorzil in {@area area 30b|5ef|x}. They wear breastplates and wield longswords (see "{@area Gorzil's Gang|55a|x}").

entries.name: 30b. High Ledge
entries: This ledge is 40 feet higher than the floor of {@area area 30a|5ed|x}. A staircase carved into the north wall climbs to {@area area 11f|595|x}.

Stationed atop the ledge is a {@creature drow mage} named Nhilisstra Argonrae, who commands a force of seven {@creature drow} (two females named Vliss and Yereth, and five males named Chabbris, Dulorrn, Fral, Helxryn, and Tra'zorrl) and six {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas}, including the troglodita leader, Gorzil (who has 20 hit points). Gorzil hates Nhilisstra and tries to kill her if he thinks he can get away with it. The trogloditas wear breastplates and wield longswords (see "{@area Gorzil's Gang|55a|x}").

Nhilisstra is charged with defending the ledge against incursions by Muiral, but she also helps defend the main cavern if it comes under attack. If that happens, she sends the trogloditas into melee combat while she and the drow attack at range.

entries.name: Aftermath
entries: If Muiral survives and the forces of House Auvryndar are routed, he animates the corpses of any dead drow and trogloditas he finds, then scatters these zombies and ghouls throughout the level.

As long as Vlonwelv lives, House Auvryndar continues to gain footholds throughout Undermountain. Vlonwelv's death, on the other hand, throws House Auvryndar into chaos as allied houses withdraw their support and align with House Freth. After securing level 11, House Freth begins a slow, steady push into Muiral's Gauntlet, putting Muiral and visiting adventurers at odds with the drow once more.

data.name: Level 11: Troglodita Warrens
entries: The Troglodita Warrens are designed for four 11th-level characters, and characters who defeat the monsters on this level should gain enough PX to reach 12th level. These reeking caverns and rough tunnels have long been home to clans of trogloditas. The presence of drow on the levels above and below has turned these warrens into a battlefield—and an opportunity for unlikely alliances.

entries.name: What Dwells Here?
entries: Trogloditas inhabit this level of Undermountain. Their dominance is contested by drow determined to enslave them, trolls twisted by Halaster's magic and hungry for troglodita flesh, and a magically enhanced behir intent on terrorizing all.

entries.name: Trogloditas
entries: The trogloditas in {@area area 2|5fb|x} on this level have been captured by drow, and they try to entice adventurers into helping them escape. Meanwhile, the strongest and last remaining free clan of trogloditas defends against encroaching drow in {@area area 7|60a|x}. The trogloditas might reveal secret locations and treasures to adventurers who eliminate their hated enemies.

entries.name: Drow
entries: Drow from House Auvryndar on {@adventure level 10|WDMM|10} and House Freth on {@adventure level 12|WDMM|12} are fighting each other for control of this level, all the while capturing trogloditas to use as slaves and doing their best to steer clear of el behir.

entries.name: Mutated Trolls
entries: The trolls of the warrens have been mutated by the glowing, rune-covered cavern at {@area area 11|626|x}. The magic of that cavern has spawned trolls with grotesque deformities and magical traits. These creatures devour trogloditas, drow, and adventurers whenever they can find them. The trolls are smart enough to avoid el behir.

entries.name: Behir
entries: This serpentine monstrosity feeds on the trogloditas and trolls, keeping their populations in check. Halaster has bestowed el behir with arcane sigils painted on its hide, which it can activate to produce potent magical effects.

El behir roams throughout the level, but characters encounter it for the first time in {@area area 17|63a|x}. Its presence can be hinted at beforehand, in the form of a flash of blue scales crossing the end of a tunnel. Huge, clawed footprints can be seen marking the ceilings of multiple caverns, and the sound of lightning and thunder erupts from time to time in the distance.

entries.name: Exploring This Level
entries: All location descriptions for this level are keyed to map 11.

entries.name: 1. Auvryndar Watch Post

entries: {@b Ceiling}. The concave ceiling of this cavern rises to a height of 20 feet.
{@b Sentries}. A female {@creature drow elite warrior} named Ventrid Xil'talan leads six {@creature drow} (two females and four males).
The drow, loyal to House Auvryndar, are tasked with guarding the tunnel that leads up to {@adventure level 10|WDMM|10}. They ambush and kill any non-drow coming from that direction.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Ventrid wears an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Auvryndar (25 gp) and a spider-shaped crystal ring set with a black pearl (750 gp).

entries.name: 2. Captured Trogloditas
entries: The cracked bones and skulls of small creatures hunted by the trogloditas litter the tunnels leading to this area, marking the borders of territory that once belonged to their clans. The invading drow from {@adventure levels 10|WDMM|10} and {@adventure 12|WDMM|12} have enslaved the trogloditas that once dwelled here and have traded occupation of this area more than once. The drow of House Auvryndar are currently in control.

entries.name: 2a. Troglodita Chain Gang
entries: The air in this cavern is heavy with the stench of twenty-two adult {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas}. They wear iron shackles on their ankles and are chained together while awaiting relocation to Muiral's Gauntlet ({@adventure level 10|WDMM|10}).

A shackled troglodita's speed is halved, and it can't move more than 5 feet away from the other trogloditas it is chained to. The drow mage in {@area area 2c|5fe|x} has the keys to the shackles. A character can pick the lock on a set of shackles una tirada de Destresa (CD 15) using thieves' tools.

Even if they are freed, the trogloditas won't flee this area while the drow are holding their young (see {@area area 2c|5fe|x}). Although initially fearful, the trogloditas engage with the characters in an attempt to turn them against the drow. They promise treasure in exchange for freeing them and their young. Characters who don't speak Troglodita and don't have access to a {@spell llenguatges} spell or similar magic can use gestures, pictures, or other crude methods to communicate with the trogloditas on a rudimentary level. Getting a message across in this way requires a successful DC 15 Carisma ({@skill Persuasió}) check.

If the characters show no interest in aiding them, the trogloditas begin to bow down and chant loudly, as if worshiping the characters. They try to catch the attention of the drow in {@area area 2c|5fe|x}, hoping this display will anger the drow and prompt them to attack the characters.

The trogloditas enter any fight against the drow, under the limitations of their shackles. If they can, they focus their attacks on Tsabdrar Do'ett (see {@area area 2c|5fe|x}), hoping to acquire the key to the shackles. Any freed troglodita tears into the drow with a vengeance.

If the characters help to liberate the trogloditas and their young from the drow, the trogloditas show the characters the secret door that leads to {@area area 2d|601|x} and allow them to take the treasure that's there. If the characters are unintentional participants in the trogloditas' escape, the trogloditas offer up the treasure only if they are subsequently threatened.

entries.name: 2b. Arch Gate to Level 6
entries: A stone arch is embedded in the west wall of this 10-foot-high cave, just around the corner from the entrance tunnel. The arch is one of Halaster's gates (see "{@area Gates|028|x}"). Carved into the arch's keystone is a hand-shaped indentation with a sigil representing magic scribed into the palm. Its rules are as follows:

items: Casting the {@spell mà de mag} cantrip and pressing its spectral fingers into the keystone's indentation opens the gate durant 1 minut.

Characters must be 9th level or higher to pass through this gate (see "{@area Jhesiyra Kestellharp|016|x}"). The first creature to pass through the gate triggers an elder rune (see "{@area Elder Runes|027|x}").
A creature that passes through the gate appears in {@area area 40 on level 6|3a8|x}, in the closest unoccupied space next to the identical gate located there.

entries.name: 2c. Amoral Dilemma

entries: {@b Monsters}. At the north end of the cave, five male {@creature Drow Elite Warrior||drow elite warriors} are holding eleven troglodita young (Small noncombatants) at sword point. A male {@creature drow mage} named Tsabdrar Do'ett is contemplating what to do with the troglodita young.
{@b Crates}. Zurkhwood crates half filled with iron chains and shackles stand in the south end of the cave.

{@b Secret Door}. A seam in the rock wall reveals a secret swivel door covered with oily troglodita secretions. Anything that touches the oily door carries the mildly revolting stench of trogloditas durant 1 hora or until the item is washed. The stench is not as potent as a troglodita's Stench trait and imposes no conditions on those who catch a whiff of it.

The drow mage is deciding whether to kill the troglodita young, because they are too small to be shackled. His inclination is to do so, and only the characters' interference stays his hand. Tsabdrar carries keys that unlock the shackles stored in this room as well as the shackles on the trogloditas in {@area area 2a|5fc|x}.

The drow investigate any commotion in {@area area 2a|5fc|x} and attack intruders who appear to be aiding or influencing the trogloditas. If the characters aren't doing so (or if they are able to negotiate an end to any initial hostilities), the drow are willing to bargain with them. They explain that a behir has been rampaging through this level, killing all the creatures it encounters. If the characters defeat el behir—and eliminate any drow of House Freth they encounter along the way—Tsabdrar promises that House Auvryndar will let them keep el behir's hoard. He also promises to spare the troglodita children. A successful DC 15 Saviesa ({@skill Perspicàcia}) check confirms that both assurances are false.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Each drow wears an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Auvryndar (25 gp). Tsabdrar also carries a thin, leather-bound spellbook containing the spells he has prepared.

entries.name: 2d. Trogloditas' Trove
entries: This cave features natural shelves lined with the skulls of the trogloditas' former leaders.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Piled on the floor in plain view is the trogloditas' wealth: 920 gp, a silvered longsword, and three amatista orbs (750 gp each).

entries.name: 3. Hungry Gnome

entries: {@b Corpses}. Eight drow corpses are splayed like rag dolls across the floor of this 10-foot-high cavern.

{@b Troll in Gnome Form}. A naked, hairless, gray-skinned gnom de les profunditatse is gnawing on one of the corpses. (The gnome is really a {@creature troll} named Xlorp, transformed by the runes in {@area area 11b|628|x}.)

In its current form, the troll has the statistics of an unarmored (AC 12), chaotic evil {@creature gnom de les profunditatse (svirfneblin)} that speaks only Giant. Casting a successful {@spell dissipar màgia} spell (DC 19) on the troll causes it to revert to its normal form. Xlorp also reverts to its normal form when its gnome form is reduced to 0 hit points. It has full hit points in its troll form, but any excess damage from the attack that caused it to revert is carried over to that form.
Xlorp follows the characters around if they give it food. It fights alongside the party, as long as it remains happy and fed. If Xlorp is mistreated in any way, it goes berserk and attacks everyone.

The drow were killed by el behir. A character who examines the bodies and succeeds on una tirada de Saviesa ({@skill Medicina}) amb CD 10 reveals that four drow are covered in burn marks consistent with llança de llamps, three were torn to pieces by large claws, and one was crushed to death (a victim of el behir's coils).

entries.name: 4. Loathsome Limbs

entries: {@b Rock Formations}. Stalactites and stalagmites fill this area.
{@b Warty Limbs}. Six severed troll limbs (five arms and one leg) and a decapitated troll head lie in pools of dark, sticky blood across the floor.
{@b Bloody Trail}. A trail of large, bloody claw marks meanders around the stalactites on the ceiling, then exits to the southwest.

When the characters pass through this area, the limbs twitch as they come to life and attack, as described in the "Variant: Loathsome Limbs" sidebar in the "Troll" entry in the {@book Monster Manual|MM}. Any character who succeeds on una tirada de Saviesa ({@skill Medicina}) amb CD 10 can identify the body parts as belonging to three separate trolls, which were torn apart and partially devoured by el behir. The tracks on the ceiling belong to el behir and fade out halfway to {@area area 14|631|x}.

entries.name: 5. Trolling the Trogloditas

entries: {@b Ceiling}. This ceiling varies in height from 15 to 30 feet.
{@b Battle}. A five-armed troll is engaged in battle with six {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas} in the northwest part of the cave.
{@b Pit}. The southwest edge of the cave borders a 30-foot-deep, yawning pit with nothing in it.
{@b Secret Door}. The north wall contains a secret door that swivels on a central axis. The secret door can be seen automatically from inside the tunnel.

If the characters watch to see how the battle plays out between the trogloditas and the troll, assume that one troglodita dies each round, while the troll's hit points do not decrease thanks to its Regeneració trait. If the characters come to the trogloditas' aid, the fearful trogloditas disengage from combat on their next turn, flee through the secret door, and retreat to {@area area 7a|60b|x}, leaving the characters to deal with the troll on their own.

The mutated troll has an extra pair of arms sprouting from its chest and a fifth arm growing out of its back. The troll has made a successful saving throw against the stench of the trogloditas. It has the statistics of a normal {@creature troll}, with these changes:

items: It has 44 hit points when the characters first arrive.
It makes an additional three claw attacks as part of its Multi-atac action.

entries: In its wounded state, the troll has a challenge rating of 6 (2,300 PX). If it regains all its hit points, its challenge rating becomes 8 (3,900 PX).

entries.name: 6. Piercer Cavern
entries: This cavern is filled with stalactites and stalagmites, and hidden among the stalactites are twenty-six {@creature Piercer||piercers}. A piercer drops onto any creature that ends its turn in the cave, until all the piercers have dropped.
North of the cavern is a 30-foot-deep, yawning pit with nothing in it. Beyond this pit lies {@area area 5|607|x}.

entries.name: 7. Troglodita Lair
entries: The last free clan of trogloditas inhabits these caves. Its members live in equal fear of el behir, the trolls, and the drow. Adventurers are perceived as just another threat until they prove otherwise. Characters who don't speak Troglodita and don't have access to a {@spell llenguatges} spell or similar magic can use gestures, pictures, or other crude methods to communicate with the trogloditas on a rudimentary level. Getting a message across in this way requires a successful DC 15 Carisma ({@skill Persuasió}) check.

entries.name: 7a. Battle-Ready Trogloditas

entries: {@b Ceiling}. Stalactites dot the ceiling, which runs from 30 feet high in the north to 50 feet high in the south.
{@b Floor}. This cavern has a muddy, uneven floor.

{@b Trogloditas}. Eighteen adult {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas} take cover behind a scattering of stalagmites. (Add to this number any trogloditas that fled from {@area area 5|607|x} or escaped from {@area area 2|5fb|x}.)

{@b Ledge}. A stone slope along the east side of the cave rises up to a long ledge toward the south. The ledge is 20 feet above the cavern floor and has four tunnels opening off it. A fiery glow spills out of the tunnel that leads to {@area area 7d|60f|x} (see that area for details).
{@b Secret Door}. A secret door at the southwest corner of the cave swivels on a central axis. The secret door can be seen automatically from inside the tunnel.

The trogloditas are bracing for another drow attack from the north. The clan's current leader is a troglodita with 20 hit points named Kol'daan. He carries a wooden sparring sword and can replace each of his claw attacks with a sword attack, dealing 4 ({@dice 1d4 + 2}) de dany contundent on a hit. Whether in battle or negotiations, Kol'daan is prone to striking heroic poses with his sparring sword and giving inspiring speeches in Troglodita.

entries.name: 7b. Battleground
entries: The floor of this damp cavern is littered with the corpses of twenty-one trogloditas and nine drow, all surrounded by pools of sticky blood and in different stages of decay (suggesting that more than one battle occurred here). The trogloditas were felled by drow weapons, while the drow were torn to pieces by the trogloditas' teeth and claws. Some of the drow corpses are half eaten.

entries.name: 7c. Wounded Trogloditas
entries: Four adult {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas} occupy this side cave. One troglodita is at full health and guards the other three, which are wounded (each has {@dice 1d6} hit points remaining). If the characters offer magical healing to all the wounded trogloditas and word of the deed gets around, they gain advantage on subsequent Carisma checks made to influence any trogloditas throughout {@area area 7|60a|x}.

entries.name: 7d. Fire Beetle Farm
entries: A fiery glow emanates from this cavern. Six {@creature Giant Fire Beetle||giant fire beetles} live here, watched over by a {@creature troglodita} with a 10-foot pole. Since being trapped by the drow, the troglodita clan has taken to raising the beetles for food.

entries.name: 7e. Halaster Formation
entries: Centuries of dripping sediment have created a rock formation on the back wall of this cavern that resembles the face of Halaster Blackcloak. The trogloditas have left small offerings around the formation, including a half dozen balls of bat guano, a garland of drow intestines, and a muddy dagger with a curved blade.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: The muddy dagger is a {@item daga verinosa}. The trogloditas are unaware of its magical nature.

entries.name: 7f. Troglodita Nursery
entries: Four adult {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas} look after twenty-two troglodita young (Small noncombatants) in this area. Two of the adults stand guard in the front cave; the other two feed and play with the young trogloditas in the rear cave.

entries.name: 7g. Chieftain's Cave
entries: The last troglodita chieftain was killed by drow some time ago, leaving Kol'daan in charge. Lurking in the chieftain's cave are three toothless old {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas}, each with 8 hit points remaining and no bite attack. These evil trogloditas served as the former chieftain's advisors. Kol'daan thinks they're weak and wants nothing to do with them. They fight only in self-defense, and each has a challenge rating of 1/8 (25 PX).

entries.name: Secret Door
entries: A secret door stands in the northwest wall of this cavern. The old trogloditas won't divulge the secret door's location, and they spit insults at anyone who dares to open it.

entries.name: 7h. Blessed Laogzed
entries: This dank cave contains a 5-foot-tall, 8-foot-diameter mud sculpture of a loathsome creature that combines the features of a demonic toad and a lizard. Any character who has an appropriate background or who succeeds on una tirada d'Intel·ligència ({@skill Religió}) amb CD 15 knows that the sculpture represents the demon-god Laogzed, worshiped by many trogloditas.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Smashing open the mud sculpture of Laogzed reveals fifty malachite gemstones (10 gp each).

entries.name: 8. Illusory Front Line
entries: The drow of House Freth have learned the hard way that the trogloditas in {@area area 7|60a|x} are too hardy and stubborn to be easily conquered. A male {@creature drow mage} named Orl Telenna has been tasked with holding these caves until reinforcements arrive. Using the resources at his disposal, Orl has created illusions designed to discourage the trogloditas from entering this area. As part of this tactic, he has the {@spell terreny il·lusori} spell prepared instead of {@spell Evard's black tentacles}, {@spell aparentar} instead of {@spell matanúvol}, i {@spell truc de la corda} instead of {@spell ego alteració}.

entries.name: 8a. False Impasse
entries: Thanks to Orl's {@spell terreny il·lusori} spell, this 20-foot-high cavern appears to be filled from wall to wall with a pool of bubbling acid. The caustic scent of the acid seems real to any creature that approaches this area, but contact with the acid deals no damage. The illusion can be removed with a successful {@spell dissipar màgia} spell (DC 14). Orl refreshes the spell each day.

entries.name: 8b. False Camp
entries: Orl has created a false camp inside a 30-foot-square area in the middle of this rubble-strewn cavern. The camp appears to be a quiet gathering of nine well-armed drow wizards and warriors, who are communicating with one another using sign language. In truth, the drow are nine troglodita {@creature Zombie||zombies} created using {@spell animar els morts} and disguised with a {@spell aparentar} spell.

entries.name: 8c. Orl's Cave

entries: {@b Water}. Fresh water trickles into this cave from cracks in the dead-end tunnels to the west, forming a 5-foot-deep pool over much of the floor.
{@b Encampment}. A rough camp is set up in an alcove to the southeast.

The alcove holds a blanket, a cask of mushroom wine, and a satchel made of spider silk that contains 10 dies de racions and Orl's spellbook (see "Treasure" below). Orl spends most of his time here, but he listens for trouble and slips out every once in a while to check {@area area 8b|619|x}.

Orl's orders don't include fighting trogloditas or well-armed adventurers singlehandedly. If he discovers any creatures approaching, he casts a {@spell truc de la corda} spell, climbs into the extradimensional space created by the spell, and pulls up the rope. He hides this way for 10 minutes before poking his head out to see if the intruders have left. If he doesn't have time to hide in this manner, he casts a {@spell invisibilitat superior} spell on himself and retreats to {@area area 9b|620|x}.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Orl's spellbook contains a drow mage's normal spells, plus {@spell animar els morts}, {@spell terreny il·lusori}, {@spell truc de la corda}, i {@spell aparentar}.

entries.name: 9. Contested Caves
entries: The drow of House Freth maintain a tenuous hold over these caves. Their defenses are tested daily by trogloditas, trolls, and infiltrators loyal to House Auvryndar.

entries.name: 9a. Hidden Threats

entries: {@b Sentries}. Two male {@creature Drow Elite Warrior||drow elite warriors} are hidden behind a natural column of rock to the north.

{@b Eater of Corpses}. The cave is full of rotting corpses (twenty trogloditas, nine drow, and five giant spiders). At the midpoint of the cavern, a fat {@creature troll} rendered permanently {@condition invisible} by Halaster's magic is feasting on one of the spider corpses.

The drow, Eilthymmar and Zaztorrl, serve House Freth. They have been watching the {@condition invisible} troll but aren't sure what to make of it. They retreat to {@area area 12|62a|x} (through {@area areas 9b|620|x}, {@area 10a|624}, i {@area 10b|625}) if threatened.

Zaztorrl's loyalty to House Freth is shaky, the result of a series of dull assignments that have left him feeling underappreciated and scornful. If the characters capture or corner him, he offers to lead them to House Freth's fortress on {@adventure level 12|WDMM|12} in exchange for his freedom. If he is treated with respect, Zaztorrl might befriend the characters and help them in battle.

A successful {@spell dissipar màgia} spell (DC 18) cast on the troll renders it visible durant 1 minut. The troll attacks any creature it sees, but retreats to {@area area 10a|624|x} (through {@area area 9d|622|x}) the first time it takes acid or fire damage.

entries.name: 9b. Drow Staging Area
entries: This 20-foot-high cavern is used as a staging area for House Freth's raids into troglodita territory. Six {@creature drow} loyal to House Freth (four females and two males) and four {@creature Shadow Demon||shadow demons} lurk here. The drow and their demon allies are planning to soften up the trogloditas in {@area area 7a|60b|x} and are not expecting to face adventurers. If four of the drow fall, the survivors use {@spell darkness} spells to cover their retreat to {@area area 13|630|x}.

entries.name: 9c. Roper Ruse
entries: The drow and the trogloditas avoid this cave because they think a roper lives here—but the creature is an illusion created by Halaster.

Characters who can see into this dark cave observe that the northernmost stalagmite has a single glaring eye, a fang-filled mouth, and six waving tendrils. A {@spell detectar màgia} spell reveals an aura of illusion magic around the stalagmite, and a successful DC 15 Intel·ligència ({@skill Investigació}) check confirms that the "roper" is a silent illusion cast on an otherwise ordinary stalagmite. A successful {@spell dissipar màgia} spell (DC 15) cast on the stalagmite ends the illusion, which doesn't attack or react to anything. Any attack or effect that targets the roper ends up targeting the stalagmite instead. The stalagmite has AC 17, 120 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. A character who sees the roper take damage can repeat the Intel·ligència ({@skill Investigació}) check to discern that it's an illusion.

entries.name: 9d. Stalagmites
entries: This 20-foot-high cavern contains a forest of stalagmites and nothing else.

entries.name: 10. Troll Tunnels
entries: The drow patrol these areas frequently, always on the lookout for the trolls that lurk here.

entries.name: 10a. Sinkhole
entries: This 30-foot-high cave is filled with the echoes of water dripping from stalactites, as well as the fluttering wings of thirteen {@creature Stirge||stirges} that live in a 30-foot-deep sinkhole to the west. The stirges attack anyone that disturbs them.

entries.name: 10b. Main Artery
entries: A mutated {@creature troll} feeds on a dismembered drow corpse in this 10-foot-high passage. The troll is a corpulent specimen covered with green boils. Whenever it takes damage, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 5 or 6, one of the troll's boils bursts open, releasing a {@b {@creature swarm of insects} (wasps)} that fills a random space within 5 feet of the troll. The swarm acts on its own initiative count and attacks the nearest creature that isn't a troll. If the troll is killed, it no longer releases any swarms.

entries.name: 11. Forest of Stone
entries: These 20-foot-high caverns are filled with stalagmites, stalactites, and other rock formations, giving this area the appearance of a dense forest of stone.

entries.name: 11a. Standing Gate to Level 8
entries: Among the rock formations is a standing gate (see "{@area Gates|028|x}") formed by a pair of 10-foot-tall stalagmites carved to create the image of giant stone snakes wrapped around them. The points of the stalagmites have been sawed off, and a lintel stone rests atop them. Chiseled into the lintel stone are the words "DON THE CRYSTAL CROWN" in Nan. The rules of this gate are as follows:

items: The gate opens for 1 minute if a creature wears King Melair's crystal crown ({@area level 6, area 11d|349|x}) while standing within 5 feet of it.

Characters must be 10th level or higher to pass through this gate (see "{@area Jhesiyra Kestellharp|016|x}"). The first creature to pass through the gate triggers an elder rune (see "{@area Elder Runes|027|x}").
A creature that passes through the gate appears in {@area area 18b on level 8|472|x}, in the closest unoccupied space next to the gate located there.

entries.name: 11b. Trollwarp Cavern

entries: {@b Stalagmites}. This 20-foot-high cave contains ten stalagmites that been twisted by Halaster's magic so that each bears a passing resemblance to the Mad Mage: an old wizard in a robe covered with lidless eyes, his visage frozen in a mad scream.
{@b Glowing Runes}. Floating above each stalagmite is a glowing rune.

A character who succeeds on una tirada d'Intel·ligència ({@skill Arcana}) amb CD 15 recognizes that the runes floating above the stalagmites represent the escola de transmutació. A {@spell detectar màgia} spell reveals an aura of transmutation magic around each stalagmite. The runes' magic poses no danger to adventurers, but it causes weird, permanent transformations in any troll that lingers in this area. (For example, a troll might sprout an extra head or tentacles, or gain some kind of magical ability or aura.) Casting {@spell dissipar màgia} on a rune causes it to vanish—and makes the stalagmite below it explode. Each creature within 20 feet of an exploding stalagmite ha de salvar per Destresa (CD 15), taking 22 ({@dice 4d10}) de dany contundent; si supera, en rep la meitat.

If the characters linger here, a magical gate might open just long enough to expel {@dice 1d4 + 2} {@creature Troll||trolls} and an equal number of chickens. The trolls immediately chase the chickens—or any other visible food source.

entries.name: 12. Drow Battle
entries: Characters who approach this 50-foot-high cavern for the first time hear the sounds of battle ahead.
{@b Demons}. In the narrower section between the north and south halves of the cavern, two {@creature Chasme||chasmes} fight a {@creature hezrou}. All three demons are glowing.
{@b Drow}. Two opposing groups of drow are peppering one another with spells and crossbow bolts, ignoring the demons. Ten drow spread out north of the demons. Sixteen drow stand south of the demons.
{@b Corpses}. The bodies of fifty drow and twenty trogloditas litter the battlefield amid pools of demon ichor. Their gear is unsalvageable.

The cavern is the site of a heated battle between House Freth (to the north) and House Auvryndar (to the south). House Freth's forces are nine male {@creature drow} led by a male {@creature drow mage} named Spirreth Dalambra. The forces of House Auvryndar are fifteen {@creature drow} (twelve females and three males) led by a female {@creature drow priestess of Lolth} named Shindreer Argonrae.
The chasmes are agents of House Freth, while the hezrou is a servant of House Auvryndar. All three demons are outlined with {@spell foc follet} spells cast on them by drow of the opposing side.

Characters who side with one drow house become the focus of the opposing house's wrath. If the characters side with the house that wins, the leader of the victorious drow parleys with them to find out what they expect in return (see below). If the characters end up on the losing side, the drow show them no mercy.

If the characters stay out of the fight, the forces on both sides dwindle slowly until the hezrou finally defeats the chasmes. The drow mage, Spirreth, escapes using {@spell invisibilitat superior}, leaving his forces to die fighting the hezrou. He has expended all his spell slots and must drink a potion (see "Treasure" below) to restore his lost hit points. If he escapes, Spirreth tries to hide and rest in {@area area 13|630|x}. The hezrou has 72 hit points remaining at the end of the fight, and Shindreer has cast none of her spells. She uses her healing magic to return the demon to full health as quickly as possible. House Auvryndar's surviving fighting force consists of six female {@creature drow}, which are healed by Shindreer's {@spell curar ferides massiu} spell.

entries.name: Spirreth Dalambra
entries: Spirreth found himself forced to assume command of House Freth's dwindling forces on this level after his superior, Beranica Freth, was killed by demons. Spirreth's job was to protect and serve Beranica. Now he faces the unwelcome task of reporting her death to her older sister, Erelal Freth, on {@adventure level 12|WDMM|12}.

If the characters help Spirreth overcome the forces of House Auvryndar, or if they corner and capture him, he slyly offers to facilitate an audience with Erelal Freth, commander of the House Freth fortress on {@adventure level 12|WDMM|12}. Spirreth declares that Erelal will want to reward them for their heroism or trade for his safe release. But the drow mage's offer is merely a desperate ploy to please his superiors, which characters can ascertain with a successful Saviesa ({@skill Perspicàcia}) check contested by his Carisma ({@skill Engany}) check. Spirreth is actually hoping to deliver the characters to Erelal Freth, then pass them off as Beranica's murderers.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Spirreth's spellbook contains all the spells he has prepared, plus {@spell corona de bogeria}, {@spell temor}, {@spell Fletxa Àcida d'en Melf}, i {@spell encàrrec}. Fastened to his cloak is an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Freth (25 gp). In a special pouch on his belt, he carries a {@item potion of Sanació Suprema} in a clear crystal vial (5 gp).

entries.name: Shindreer Argonrae
entries: Shindreer is a powerful member of her small drow house, and she has pledged its strength to the larger cause of House Auvryndar. She also considers Vlonwelv Auvryndar her mortal enemy, however, and has plans to depose her—thus reversing the relationship of fealty between Houses Auvryndar and Argonrae.

Fully aware of her rival's ambitions, Vlonwelv ordered Shindreer to the front lines in the mounting conflict against House Freth. Vlonwelv was counting on House Freth to take care of Shindreer for her, but Shindreer has proven harder to kill than Vlonwelv anticipated.
If the characters killed Vlonwelv on {@adventure level 10|WDMM|10} and they share this information with Shindreer, she becomes enraged that they deprived her of that pleasure and attacks them.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Shindreer wears spider silk gloves with bloodstones sewn into them (750 gp for the pair) and a silver holy symbol of Lolth (25 gp). Worked into the handle of her scourge is an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Argonrae (25 gp).
