entries.name: 13. Freth Refuge
entries: Thick web curtains are strung between the stalactites and stalagmites that fill this 30-foot-high cavern. Unless they are cut down or burned away, the webs create a veritable maze, reducing visibility in the cavern to 10 feet. They also catch bats, lizards, and stirges, many of which are still alive and squawking.

At the north end of the cavern, hidden behind a stalagmite, is a cache of supplies left here by drow scouts of House Freth. The supplies include a cask of mushroom wine, 20 dies de racions (dry meat and moss) in a satchel made of lizard skin, and a sealed gourd containing 20 applications of {@item metzina de dróu} (see "{@book Poisons|DMG|8|Poisons}" in chapter 8 of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}).

entries.name: 14. Auvryndar Watch Post

entries: {@b Ceiling}. The ceiling and floor in this area are uneven, the distance between them ranging from 20 to 40 feet. Three natural columns of rock support the roof.
{@b Scouts}. Two female {@creature Drow Elite Warrior||drow elite warriors} (named Akora and Danafay) are mounted on {@creature Giant Lizard||giant lizards} near the center of the cavern.

The drow attack at the first sign of intruders. Their lizards are fitted with saddles, reins, and stirrups, and have the Spider Climb trait (see the "Variant: Giant Lizard Traits" sidebar in appendix A of the {@book Monster Manual|MM}). The drow take the lizards up the walls so they can get a better look at the characters as they approach.
If the characters veer toward {@area area 12|62a|x} from here, Akora and Danafay try to get there first to warn Shindreer.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Each drow wears an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Auvryndar (25 gp).

entries.name: 15. Cleared-Out Caves
entries: Trogloditas once lived here, but most of them were captured by drow or devoured by el behir and the trolls.

entries.name: 15a. Filthy Den
entries: Once a troglodita den, this 20-foot-high cave is strewn with filth. Foul, oily secretions on the walls were left there by the trogloditas.

entries.name: 15b. Stone Troll
entries: A mutated {@creature troll} is searching through piles of troglodita filth for edibles. The troll looks normal but has a peculiar trait. A l'inici de cada torn seu, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, the troll turns to stone i està {@condition petrificat} fins a l'inici del seu següent torn. Casting a {@spell restabliment superior} spell on the troll rids it of this magical malady.

entries.name: 15c. Empty Nursery
entries: The trogloditas once raised their young here, and the floor is strewn with the bones of vermin.

entries.name: 16. Arch Gate to Level 7
entries: Embedded in the north wall of this 10-foot-high cave is a stone arch. Carved into its keystone is a picture of a hand clutching a lit torch. The arch is one of Halaster's magic gates (see "{@area Gates|028|x}"). Its rules are as follows:

items: If a lit torch is brought within 5 feet of the arch, the gate opens durant 1 minut.

Characters must be 9th level or higher to pass through this gate (see "{@area Jhesiyra Kestellharp|016|x}"). The first creature to pass through the gate triggers an elder rune (see "{@area Elder Runes|027|x}").
A creature that passes through the gate appears in {@area area 29 on level 7|41c|x}, in the closest unoccupied space next to the identical gate located there.

entries.name: 17. Behir Lair
entries: The floor of el behir's musty lair is covered with broken bones that crunch underfoot. Creatures that walk on the floor have disadvantage on Destresa ({@skill Sigil}) checks made to move silently through these caves.
{@b Rock Formations}. Sharp-pointed stalagmites and stalactites fill this 40-foot-high cave, giving it the appearance of a toothy maw. Harmless bats flutter between the stalactites.
{@b Lightning Flashes}. If el behir is in {@area area 17c|63e|x}, sporadic flashes of blue-white light appear in the tunnel leading to that area, accompanied by a crackling noise.

entries.name: 17b. Crushed Drow
entries: The half-eaten corpse of a recently slain male drow leans against the stalagmite at the northern entrance to this 30-foot-high cave. The drow's chest is caved in where el behir stepped on it.

entries.name: 17c. Behir
entries: The {@creature behir} lies in wait in this 50-foot-high cavern, its muscled, serpentine body woven through the stalagmites. Scars are carved into its hide in the form of arcane runes, placed there by Halaster. The runes grant el behir the ability to use the following legendary actions.

entries.name: Legendary Actions
entries: El behir can take three legendary actions, choosing from the options below. It can take only one legendary action at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. El behir regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn. Its habilitat de llançament de conjurs is Carisma (spell save DC 13).
{@b Lesser Magic}. El behir casts {@spell esprai de colors} or {@spell adormir}, sense requerir components.
{@b Greater Magic (Costa 2 Accions)}. El behir casts {@spell invisibility} or {@spell pas boira}, sense requerir components.

entries.name: 17d. Hoard of el behir
entries: This ledge stands 30 feet above the floor of {@area area 17c|63e|x} and 20 feet below the cavern roof. El behir has fashioned a nest of bones here, decorated with gleaming coins and gems.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: El behir's hoard includes 6,700 gp, 4,100 sp, a gold-and-onyx scorpion brooch (250 gp), a silver music box of elven design (1,000 gp), and a {@item dread helm|XGE}. A common wondrous item, the {@item dread helm|XGE} is a fearsome steel helm that makes its wearer's eyes glow red.

entries.name: Aftermath
entries: Houses Auvryndar and Freth continue to send forces to this level until their strongholds (on {@adventure levels 10|WDMM|10} and {@adventure 12|WDMM|12}, respectively) are destroyed. In addition to drow, adventurers could find themselves facing demons sent by the drow to destroy el behir. Drow that succeed in killing el behir take its treasure back to their stronghold.

If the characters eliminate el behir, neutralize the trolls, and deal crippling blows to House Freth and House Auvryndar on this level, the trogloditas grow in strength and numbers. Even if the trogloditas are also eliminated, new clans journey here from elsewhere in Undermountain. Emboldened by their lack of enemies, trogloditas that regain control of their former warrens turn hostile toward all other creatures, regardless of any past truces.

data.name: Level 12: Maze Level
entries: The Maze Level is designed for four 12th-level characters, and characters who defeat the monsters on this level should gain enough PX to advance halfway to 13th level.

entries.name: What Dwells Here?
entries: This level is a battleground between drow of House Freth and a tribe of minotaures. The minotaures hold sway over a maze of tunnels riddled with magical effects and traps, while the drow occupy the caves around an elegant fortress called Spiderwatch Keep—a staging ground for House Freth's goal of conquering all of Undermountain.

Hostilities between the drow and the minotaures have recently abated, in the wake of devastating losses on both sides. Drivvin Freth, a drow archmage, hopes to use this respite to his house's advantage by summoning a goristro demon that will force the minotaures to submit to House Freth's control.

entries.name: House Freth
entries: From their dark bastion, the leaders of the house strive to keep their enemies, House Auvryndar (see {@adventure level 10|WDMM|10}), from conquering the Troglodita Warrens ({@adventure level 11|WDMM|11}). Leading the effort is Erelal Freth, a drow priestess of Lolth. Her older brother Drivvin works at her side.

Erelal has communed with Lolth and believes that the key to securing the Troglodita Warrens begins with the capitulation of the minotaures on the Maze Level. Once the minotaures are subservient to House Freth, the drow will use them to clear out and secure the warrens. To this end, Drivvin is devising a ritual to summon and control a goristro demon. By passing the goristro off as Baphomet, the demon lord of minotaures, he hopes to win the minotaures' obedience. But Drivvin has recently realized that his arcane knowledge is not sufficient to allow him to perfect the ritual—and he's afraid of admitting his inadequacy to his sister.

The nature of the characters' prior association with House Auvryndar might affect how members of House Freth view them. If the characters collaborated with House Auvryndar and this fact becomes known to the leaders of House Freth, all future encounters with members of House Freth are likely to be hostile.

entries.name: Shadowdusk Emissaries
entries: Two low-ranking members of the Shadowdusk family (see {@adventure level 22|WDMM|22}) arrived at Spiderwatch Keep a few days ago, claiming to be emissaries from Shadowdusk Hold who were seeking an alliance with House Freth. Tendra Nightblade and Maleen Shadowdusk have been feted and flattered by Erelal Freth since they arrived. The drow priestess recognizes the potential benefit of an alliance, although she is also trying to ascertain whether Shadowdusk Hold has made similar overtures to House Auvryndar.

What Erelal doesn't realize is that House Shadowdusk has no interest in an alliance, and Tendra and Maleen have come to the Maze Level on a secret mission. Beholden to Halaster Blackcloak, the Shadowdusks have been ordered to convince Drivvin Freth to accept an apprenticeship under the Mad Mage. They have secretly informed him of Halaster's interest and of Halaster's offer to help him perfect the ritual that will bind a goristro to House Freth's service. They now wait for Drivvin's decision, while doing everything they can to ensure that he makes the right choice.

entries.name: Minotaures
entries: Twenty-three minotaures inhabit the southern half of the Maze Level. They spend most of their time fighting the drow. Their leader is a priest of Baphomet named Maku, a devout follower of the Horned King who has tried to summon the demon lord on numerous occasions. The minotaure priest believes that his ritual will be successful if he can amass a large enough pile of mutilated corpses for the demon lord to feast on.

entries.name: Baphomet the Horned King
entries: Baphomet is worshiped by those who strive to break the confines of civility and unleash their inner bestial nature. All minotaures on the Maze Level seek to emulate him through their blood lust and savagery. He appears as a great, black-furred minotaure with iron horns, burning red fire in his eyes, and a massive bloodstained glaive. Fervent human cultists of Baphomet are sometimes transformed into minotaures as a reward for their devotion and sacrifice.

entries.name: Exploring This Level
entries: All location descriptions for this level are keyed to map 12.

A 2-foot-thick layer of fog covers the floor in many of the Maze Level's tunnels and caves; the area within the fog is heavily obscured. The fog can be cleared away by a {@spell ràfega de vent} spell or similar magic. Fog that is cleared away returns in 1 minute.
The stench of death pervades the entire level, growing stronger as the characters get closer to area 8a.

entries.name: 1. Into the Laberint
entries: These caves have 20-foot-high ceilings. Their floors are covered by a 2-foot-thick layer of fog.

entries.name: 1a. Rusty Head
entries: The rusted, severed head of a shield guardian lies on its side in the middle of the cave, under the fog. The minotaures destroyed the construct and carried off its body for use in fashioning weapons, leaving its head behind.

entries.name: 1b. Foggy Alcove
entries: The fog obscures the skeleton of a duergar lying on the floor near the back wall of this alcove. The duergar was impaled through the back with a broken-off stalactite by one of his kin and the body hidden here. The stalactite is still lodged in the duergar's skeleton, which has been picked clean by vermin.

entries.name: 2. Light of the Dead
entries: The earthen floors of these caves are covered by a 2-foot-thick layer of fog.

entries.name: 2a. Will-o'-Wisp
entries: Two columns of rock support the roof of this 15-foot-high cave, the walls of which are spattered with blood from recent battles between drow and minotaures.

An {@condition invisible} {@creature will-o'-wisp} dwells here, the dark essence of a female drow priestess named Z'reska, who was butchered by minotaures. As the characters move through the cave, the will-o'-wisp flies into the tunnel that leads northwest out of this area and illuminates itself. It whispers, "Follow me!" in Èlfic, trying to stay at least 50 feet ahead of characters who do so. It attempts to lure creatures into {@area area 7|65a|x} and provoke a battle with the minotaures. If the characters refuse to follow the will-o'-wisp, it turns {@condition invisible} and trails them instead, waiting until one or more characters are near death before attacking them in an attempt to finish them off.

entries.name: 2b. Broken Lute
entries: Hidden under the fog in this 10-foot-high alcove is a lute carved of pale wood. The instrument has been smashed beyond repair. A silver-inlaid Èlfic inscription on its broken neck reads "Korynn."

entries.name: 3. Dead End
entries: The earthen floor of this tunnel is covered by a 2-foot-thick layer of fog. A twisting side tunnel with a rocky floor opens up to the northwest, rising out of the fog before coming to a dead end.

entries.name: 4. Faces in the Fog
entries: The floor of this 15-foot-high side cave is covered by a 2-foot-thick layer of fog. Ghostly visages periodically take shape in the fog and then disappear—all of them adventurers who have perished in Undermountain.

entries.name: 5. Demon's Triangle

entries: {@b Floor}. The earthen floor of this cavern is covered by a 2-foot-thick layer of fog.

{@b Pillars}. Three natural pillars of rock support the 25-foot-high ceiling. The fog takes on a red tinge in the area between the pillars, each of which is painted with the fearsome image of a 20-foot-tall minotaure painted in blood.
Any character who succeeds on una tirada d'Intel·ligència ({@skill Religió}) amb CD 15 recognizes that the paintings on the rock pillars represent Baphomet the Horned King.

entries.name: Madness of Baphomet
entries: Any humanoid that enters the area between the pillars or starts its turn there ha de salvar per Saviesa (CD 18). Si falla, manifest a character flaw that lasts until the victim is subjected to a {@spell anul·lar maledicció} spell, a {@spell restabliment superior} spell, or similar magic. The flaw supersedes any conflicting flaw and is determined by rolling on the Madness of Baphomet table. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw can't be affected by the pillars again for 24 hours.

entries.caption: Madness of Baphomet
rows: "My anger consumes me. I can't be reasoned with when my rage has been stoked."
"I degenerate into beastly behavior, seeming more like a wild animal than a thinking being."
"The world is my hunting ground. Others are my prey."
"Hate comes easily to me and explodes into rage."
"I see those who oppose me not as people, but as beasts meant to be preyed upon."

entries.name: 6. Special Effects
entries: These areas contain some of the Mad Mage's harmless regional effects (see "{@area Halaster's Lair|bb9|x}"). The earthen floor throughout is covered by a 2-foot-thick layer of fog.

entries.name: 6a. "Help Me!"
entries: The first time a character reaches this intersection, a faint call for help is heard coming from the tunnel opening to the north, which ends at a cave-in. The cry for help is an illusion, and characters who dig through the rubble find nothing in it.

entries.name: 6b. Rattling Chains
entries: This 10-foot-high tunnel slopes up gradually to the north, so that its floor rises above the fog. Characters who pass this point hear rattling chains when they get to the fork in the tunnel. The sound clearly comes from the left passage. Further investigation reveals no source; the sound is one of Halaster's illusory regional effects. The passage to the right contains nothing of interest.

entries.name: Mirror Gate to Level 10
entries: At the end of the west tunnel, a tall oval mirror framed in stone hangs on the rocky wall. The mirror's frame is carved with vines that twist through eleven actual humanoid skulls mounted to the frame. Carved into the bottom of the frame are the following words in Celestial: "The dead know the secret."
The mirror is one of Halaster's gates (see "{@area Gates|028|x}"). Its rules are as follows:

items: Speaking the proper paraula màgica while standing in front of the mirror opens the gate durant 1 minut.

Characters must be 11th level or higher to pass through this gate (see "{@area Jhesiyra Kestellharp|016|x}"). The first creature to pass through the gate triggers an elder rune (see "{@area Elder Runes|027|x}").
A creature that passes through the gate appears in {@area area 11e on level 10|592|x}, in the closest unoccupied space next to the identical gate located there.

entries: Casting {@spell parlar amb els morts} on one of the skulls forces it to reveal the gate's paraula màgica ("Axallian"), which Halaster changes every few days. The skulls are otherwise hostile and refuse to answer questions put to them.

entries.name: 6c. Giggles
entries: The earthen floor of this 20-foot-high cave is slightly concave, causing the fog to pool to a depth of 4 feet.

Whenever two or more creatures are inside the cave, the sound of an old man giggling can be heard everywhere in the area. No one outside the cave can hear the giggling, which ends as soon as the cave is no longer occupied by two or more creatures.

entries.name: 7. Minotaure Caves
entries: These caves form the main living area for the minotaures of the Maze Level. A 2-foot-thick layer of fog covers the floor throughout.

entries.name: 7a. Southern Cave

entries: {@b Ceiling}. The ceiling ranges in height from 20 to 30 feet and is covered with stalactites.

{@b Minotaures}. Stalagmites and floor-to-ceiling columns of rock are scattered across the area, the fog flowing slowly around them. Seven {@creature Minotaure||minotaures} lurk behind the stalagmites and rock columns.

The minotaures are stationed throughout the cavern, guarding against a drow attack. They are famished, having been forced to sacrifice their food for Maku's ritual (see {@area area 8a|661|x}). They spring out when they see or hear any creatures in this area, charging intruders and ignoring any attempts to parley. The minotaures fight to the death and loudly devour their kills if they are victorious. Any sound of combat in this area brings the five {@creature Minotaure||minotaures} in {@area area 7b|65d|x} as reinforcements.

entries.name: 7b. Northern Cave
entries: This cave has the same features as {@area area 7a|65b|x}. Five {@creature Minotaure||minotaures} stand watch in this area and attack in response to any intrusion. The sound of combat here brings the seven {@creature Minotaure||minotaures} from {@area area 7a|65b|x} as reinforcements.

entries.name: 7c. Minotaure Graveyard
entries: The minotaures place their dead in this wedge-shaped cave, which has the following features:
{@b Bones}. The fog that covers the floor wraps around six large piles of minotaure bones.
{@b Skulls}. Dozens of minotaure skulls in various states of decay are jammed into niches and crevices in the walls.

entries.name: 8. Shrine of the Horned King
entries: Maku, a minotaure shaman, has been busily collecting the remains of slaughtered drow, fallen trogloditas and quaggoths, and unfortunate adventurers in this area. He plans to use these remains in a ritual to summon the demon lord Baphomet. If the characters fought any minotaures in {@area area 7b|65d|x}, Maku and his followers cannot be surprised here.

entries.name: 8a. Keep Calm and Carrion
entries: The stench of death that permeates the dungeon is strongest here. As the characters approach this 50-foot-high cave, they hear minotaures chanting and stomping. This area contains the following:
{@b Minotaures}. The fog swirls through this cavern, agitated by the dancing of eleven chanting {@creature Minotaure||minotaures}.
{@b Offal Pile}. Low stone barriers constrain a massive pile of rotting, dismembered body parts.

{@b Altar}. Behind the offal pile stands a crude altar made of minotaure fur stretched over a frame of sinew-lashed minotaure bones. Two poles thrust out of the altar, each with a minotaure skull atop it.
{@b Secret Door}. The secret door in the west wall is an 8-foot-square section of stone that pivots on a central axis.

The minotaures are led by Maku, who has 117 hit points, wears a shawl made of drow entrails, and clutches a brass horn (see "Treasure" below). The minotaure shaman treats all intruders as enemies to be carved up and added to his pile of dismembered bodies. His first action in combat is to blow his brass horn while the other minotaures try to hack intruders to pieces.

Baphomet does not answer prayers, nor does the demon lord have any interest in Maku's tribe. As such, the minotaure shaman's ritual has no chance of working. But the sacrifices performed in this area have saturated the cave with evil power, such that any humanoid that makes a weapon attack in this area ha de salvar per Saviesa (CD 18). Si falla, be cursed with blood lust. While cursed in this way, the creature is hostile toward all other creatures it can see and must use its action each turn to attack the creature closest to it. (If multiple targets are equally close, the target is determined randomly.) {@spell Restabliment Superior}, {@spell anul·lar maledicció}, or similar magic ends the blood lust on a creature. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw against this effect is immune to it for the next 24 hours.

The altar is made out of two minotaures that were killed and devoured in a cannibalistic ritual. Any creature that touches the altar experiences a ghastly vision of being torn apart and eaten by minotaures.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Maku carries a {@item horn of the Endless Laberint|WDMM}. This wondrous item functions as a brass {@item horn of Valhalla}, except that the warrior spirits it summons come from the Abyss and look like minotaures.

A single character can search through the pile of body parts in 1 hour, while multiple characters working together can reduce the search time proportionally. A {@spell detectar màgia} spell can further expedite a specific search for magic items. The search yields a spider silk pouch containing 50 gp, two obsidian scarabs engraved with the insignia of House Freth (25 gp each), a jeweled anklet (750 gp), and one of a pair of {@item gloves of missile snaring} worn on the severed limb of its previous drow owner. (The matching glove can be found in area 8b.)
{@b Fog}. A 2-foot-high blanket of fog covers the floor. Hidden under the fog in the northern alcove is a treasure pile (see "Treasure" below).
{@b Standing Stones}. At the south end of the cave are two 15-foot-tall standing stones hewn from black basalt. Carved into the lintel stone spanning them is a large blood-red X.

entries.name: Standing Gate to Level 19
entries: The standing stones form one of Halaster's magic gates (see "{@area Gates|028|x}"). When a creature comes within 5 feet of the gate, rivulets of blood begin to seep from the standing stones. The rules of this gate are as follows:

items: The gate opens for 1 minute if a creature marked with a bloody X stands within 5 feet of it.

Characters must be 15th level or higher to pass through this gate (see "{@area Jhesiyra Kestellharp|016|x}"). The first creature to pass through the gate triggers an elder rune (see "{@area Elder Runes|027|x}").
A creature that passes through the gate appears in {@area area 5b on level 19|9a0|x}, in the closest unoccupied space next to the identical gate located there.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Characters who find the treasure in the north alcove discover a set of weaver's tools, fourteen shortswords and six hand crossbows of drow manufacture, a sack of mushroom flour, a spider silk satchel containing 8 dies de racions (dry moss and mushrooms), a silver holy symbol of Lolth (25 gp), and a {@i glove of missile snaring} (the matching glove can be found in area 8a). All these items are strewn atop 200 gp and 1,700 sp.

entries.name: 9. Foggy Caves
entries: The fog is thicker in these caverns, rising above the floor to a height of 4 feet.

entries.name: 9a. Ambush Point
entries: The fog in this otherwise empty 10-foot-high cave conceals a group of sentries from Spiderwatch Keep. Two {@creature Drow Elite Warrior||drow elite warriors}, a female named Llorelve Dalambra and a male named Vorljas Imphiz'zal, are on guard here with two {@creature Incubus||incubi} disguised as a pair of unarmed, scantily clad, supremely handsome male drow named Ezvir and Zaldo. All four are crouched down in the fog.

Llorelve and Vorljas spring up at the first sounds of creatures approaching this area, and they attack anyone they don't recognize. Any humanoids they don't know are assumed to be allied with House Auvryndar.

When either incubus is reduced to 30 hit points or fewer, it uses its next action to become ethereal and doesn't rejoin the battle. It might reappear later to exact its revenge on those who harmed it, in a place and form of your choosing.

entries.name: 9b. Shapes in the Fog
entries: As the characters move through this 10-foot-high cave, the fog here rises and coalesces into threatening, minotaure-like forms wielding greataxes. These fog minotaures are regional effects created by Halaster Blackcloak (see "{@area Halaster's Lair|bb9|x}"). Each apparition takes a harmless swing at any creatures that pass through the area before sinking back into the fog.

entries.name: 9c. Unpleasant Descent
entries: This 10-foot-high passage slopes down gently as it runs northward. At its final bend, the fog fills the entire passage, the last 20 feet of which are heavily obscured.

At the end of the tunnel, hidden beneath a breakaway floor, is a 30-foot-deep pit with stone spikes at the bottom. A creature that steps on the breakaway floor falls into the pit, taking 10 ({@dice 3d6}) de dany contundent from the fall and 10 ({@dice 3d6}) de dany perforant from the spikes. The pit remains open once the breakaway floor falls away. A character can spot the breakaway floor with a successful DC 13 Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) check, but only if the fog has been cleared away.

entries.name: 9d. Arch Gate to Level 6
entries: A stone arch is embedded into the wall at the northeast end of this cavern. Carved into the arch's keystone is an image of a hand pouring ale from a flagon. The arch is one of Halaster's magic gates (see "{@area Gates|028|x}"). The rules of this gate are as follows:

items: If one pint or more of any liquid is poured on the floor within 5 feet of the arch, the gate opens durant 1 minut.

Characters must be 9th level or higher to pass through this gate (see "{@area Jhesiyra Kestellharp|016|x}"). The first creature to pass through the gate triggers an elder rune (see "{@area Elder Runes|027|x}").
A creature that passes through the gate appears in {@area area 34a on level 6|38c|x}, in the closest unoccupied space next to the identical gate located there.

entries: {@b Fog}. The earthen floor of this 10-foot-high tunnel is covered by a 2-foot-thick layer of fog.
{@b Web Cables}. Web cables crisscross the passageway and its alcoves (see the "Web Cables" sidebar).

entries.name: Web Cables
entries: The sections of the Maze Level controlled by House Freth are defended by barriers of thick webs as strong as iron cables. These webs are produced by an iron spider construct created and controlled by Drivvin Freth. The spider is stored in {@area area 12b|677|x} when it's not being used to create webs.

The web cables strung in {@area areas 10|66d|x} through {@area 17|683} are designed to keep minotaures and other oversized creatures out of places controlled by House Freth. The crisscrossing cables have gaps between them that Medium and smaller creatures can slip through easily. Larger creatures that can fit through a 2-foot-square hole can also pass through these gaps, but all others are unable to do so. The cables are slightly sticky to the touch, but cannot bind or hold creatures.

Each web cable has AC 19, 40 hit points, resistance to piercing damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. A creature can snap a cable as an action with a successful DC 30 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check.

entries.name: 11. Crickets and Bats
entries: Any bright light in this broad cavern alerts the demons on watch in {@area area 17|683|x} and the drow guards in areas 18a through 18d. The cave contains the following:

{@b Fog}. The floor here is covered by a 2-foot-thick layer of fog that obscures mounds of bat guano. (If the fog is cleared away, drow, quaggoth, and giant lizard tracks can be seen in the guano. The tracks go in all directions, but most lead west toward the drow fortress.)

{@b Bat Alarm}. Hundreds of {@creature Bat||bats} cling to the 30-foot-high domed ceiling. The drow use the bats as an alarm of sorts, knowing that the creatures become agitated and expect to be fed whenever humanoids enter the cave.
{@b Web Cables}. The tunnels leading to {@area areas 12a|67e|x} and {@area 12b|677} rise up out of the fog and are strung with web cables.

The drow release crickets into this area to feed the bats. Expecting to be fed, the bats start to shriek and flap about the cave when the characters arrive, alerting the drow guards in {@area areas 12a|67e|x}, {@area 12b|677}, i {@area 18a|68b}.

entries.name: 12. Guarded Caves
entries: These caves and the tunnels connecting them are free of fog.

entries.name: 12a. Standing Gate to Level 14
entries: House Freth posts guards here to watch for trouble that might ascend from {@adventure level 13|WDMM|13}. Several tunnels leading to this 20-foot-high cave are strung with web cables. One such tunnel slopes down gently to {@area area 11|670|x}.
{@b Undead}. Six {@creature Minotaure Skeleton||minotaure skeletons} stand in the middle of the cave, ready to attack any creature that isn't a drow.

{@b Drow}. Four male {@creature Drow Elite Warrior||drow elite warriors} hide in the dead-end tunnels to the south. Any character who has a passive Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) score of 20 or higher spots these guards.
{@b Standing Stones}. The northern part of the cave contains two large standing stones, each of which has an inanimate minotaure skeleton embedded in it.

If a battle erupts here, the drow in {@area area 12b|677|x} use signal horns to sound the alarm before joining the fight. They are quickly joined by reinforcements from {@area areas 12c|679|x} and {@area 12d|67a}.

These drow are well trained, and their loyalty to House Freth is beyond question. Their leader, Tanimar Freth, is the second of Erelal's three sons. He lost his right eye in a sword fight against a House Auvryndar rival; his empty eye socket and scar are plain for all to see. One consequence of his injury is that Tanimar has been relegated to guard duty. He fights alongside his younger brother, Xaphtal Freth. The other two drow are named Hexab Do'ett and Moltar Barrek'zorn.

If the battle turns against them, the drow use {@spell darkness} spells to cover their retreat to the fortress (area 18). They know the tunnels well enough to navigate them blindly. Xaphtal seizes any opportunity to dispose of his older brother, provided the risk to himself is minimal. The other drow are not surprised by Xaphtal's treachery—Tanimar least of all.

entries.name: Standing Gate
entries: The standing stones form one of Halaster's magic gates (see "{@area Gates|028|x}"). Its rules are as follows:

items: Any creature that touches one of the standing stones is targeted by a {@spell laberint} (CD 22).
To open the gate, a creature must be trapped in the maze created by the spell, then escape. When the creature returns to the space it left, the gate opens durant 1 minut.

Characters must be 13th level or higher to pass through this gate (see "{@area Jhesiyra Kestellharp|016|x}"). The first creature to pass through the gate triggers an elder rune (see "{@area Elder Runes|027|x}").
A creature that passes through the gate appears in {@area area 2d on level 14|723|x}, in the closest unoccupied space next to the identical gate located there.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Fastened to Tanimar's cloak is an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Freth (25 gp). He also carries a spider silk pouch that contains two peridots (500 gp each).

entries.name: 12b. Iron Spider
entries: Several tunnels leading to this 30-foot-high cave are festooned with web cables. The south tunnels slope down gently to {@area areas 11|670|x} and {@area 18|689}.
{@b Guards}. Four male {@creature drow} are on guard here.
{@b Iron Spider}. A giant iron spider stands motionless in the middle of the cave.

The drow (named Freb, Rylzzt, Urlimar, and Vanalfein) all carry signal horns that sound an alarm loud enough to be heard in {@area areas 10|66d|x} through {@area 19|69a}. They raise the alarm at the first sign of intruders, bringing reinforcements from {@area areas 12a|67e|x}, {@area 12c|679}, i {@area 12d|67a}.

The iron spider is a Large unaligned construct that stands 7 feet tall. It has AC 19, 80 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Its ability scores are as follows: Força 18, Destresa 10, Constitució 10, Intel·ligència 3, Saviesa 3, and Carisma 1. Its climbing and walking speeds are 30 feet, and it pot escalar superfícies difícils (incloent cap per avall pels sostres) sense haver de fer una tirada d'habilitat. It has {@sense visió a cegues} out to a range of 60 feet and is blind beyond this radius.

Com a acció, the iron spider can shoot out a 6-inch-thick web cable up to 50 feet long, attaching the far end of the cable to a solid surface up to 50 feet away from it. Com a acció bonus, it can detach the other end of the cable from itself and attach it to a solid surface within 10 feet of it. Once it creates 200 feet of web cable, the spider can't produce any more cable until the next dawn. The iron spider exists solely to produce web cables. It has no attacks and no instinct for self-preservation.

Like a scaladar, the iron spider has a control ring (possessed by Drivvin Freth). The iron spider obeys the commands of whoever wears its control ring. The spider is {@condition incapacitat} in the area of an {@spell camp antimàgic} spell. If targeted by a {@spell dissipar màgia} spell, the spider ha de salvar per Constitució contra la CD de salvada de conjur de qui el llança. Si falla, cau {@condition inconscient} durant 1 minut.

entries.name: 12c. Quaggoths
entries: This 30-foot-high cavern and the tunnels leading to it are strung with web cables (see the "{@area Web Cables|66d|x}" sidebar). Nine {@creature Quaggoth||quaggoths} creep along the cables, attempting to hide from any creatures that enter the area. The quaggoths drop to the floor or crawl down the walls to attack intruders they don't recognize.

entries.name: 12d. Giant Lizard Pen

entries: {@b Monsters}. Ten docile {@creature Giant Lizard||giant lizards} are tethered to espigues de ferro pounded into the cave floor. Five {@creature drow}, one female and four males, watch over the lizards.
{@b Fungi}. The 20-foot-high walls are covered with ripplebark (see "{@area Fungi|236|x}"), which the drow feed to the giant lizards.

The leader of this group is a female drow named Talabsyn Freth, the youngest of Erelal's seven daughters. The others are unfaithful male subordinates named Beleth, Cazimir, Ryldgar, and Zakth. At the first sign of trouble, Talabsyn untethers the nearest giant lizard and tries to escape on its back, fleeing to her family's fortress by the safest route while the males cover her escape. If her escape routes are cut off, Talabsyn surrenders and orders the males to do the same, hoping her captors try to ransom her. She betrays any of the male drow in a heartbeat to save herself—and the males do the same to her.

Drow scouts use the giant lizards as mounts. Each comes equipped with a saddle, reins, stirrups, and motxilles de sella containing 30 dies de racions (dry moss and mushrooms). The giant lizards have the Spider Climb trait (see the "Variant: Giant Lizard Traits" sidebar in appendix A of the {@book Monster Manual|MM}), which allows them to climb over the web cables and exit this area.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Fastened to Talabsyn's cloak is an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Freth (25 gp).

entries.name: 13. Roundabout
entries: A {@creature bore worm|WDMM}—a metal construct similar in size and shape to a cuc lila—hollowed out this donut-shaped chamber as part of excavating the passage that leads down to {@adventure level 13|WDMM|13}. Characters who descend to {@adventure level 13|WDMM|13} encounter the worm (see "{@area Bore Worm|6b5|x}").

Once an hour, the bore worm makes its way up the tunnel from {@adventure level 13|WDMM|13} and circles this area clockwise before returning below. The worm doesn't fill the entire tunnel, so smaller creatures can try to slip past it. When the worm enters a smaller creature's space for the first time on a turn, that creature ha de salvar per Destresa. Si supera, the creature avoids being crushed between the worm and the tunnel wall. Si falla, rep 22 ({@dice 4d10}) de dany contundent.

entries.name: 14. Dead End?
entries: This 15-foot-high cave extends beneath {@area area 15|680|x}. It contains the following features:
{@b Web Cables}. Web cables crisscross the tunnel that leads into this area.

{@b Rock Formation}. A 10-foot-high, 10-foot-wide rock formation shaped like a huge clawed hand thrusts up from the floor in the west end of the cave. (A secret door is built into the ceiling directly above the claw.)

The claw is a natural rock formation and shows no sign of having been sculpted. Creatures can easily climb up onto it. Lying on the floor next to the claw, in plain sight, is a stubby iron key with a head shaped like a tiny bulbous nose. This key unlocks the iron doors of Zox Clammersham's palace (see {@area area 7 on level 13|6d8|x}).

The secret door in the ceiling can be reached by anyone who stands atop the rock formation. The door is an 8-foot-square, 1-foot-thick slab of stone that pivots on a central axis. Pushing or pulling it open from below requires a successful DC 20 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check. The secret door remains open until it is manually closed again.

entries.name: 15. Crickets
entries: The characters hear the incessant chirping of crickets as they approach this 20-foot-high cavern. The area has the following features:
{@b Web Cables}. Both tunnels leading to the cavern are strung with web cables.
{@b Crates}. Dispersed throughout the cavern are ten large zurkhwood crates with mesh screens covering their open tops.
{@b Secret Door}. A secret door is set into the floor.

Each crate contains hundreds of harmless, chirping cave crickets, feeding from a 1-foot-deep bed of bat guano mixed with maggot-ridden offal. The cave crickets are used by the drow to feed the bats in {@area area 11|670|x}.

The secret door in the floor is an 8-foot-square, 1-foot-thick slab of stone that pivots on a central axis. Opening it requires a successful DC 15 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check. Applying 150 pounds of weight to either side of the door also causes it to swing open. Any creature that accidentally opens the door by standing on it can avoid a fall by making a successful DC 15 Destresa saving throw. A creature that falls through the open door drops 10 feet and lands on the claw-shaped rock formation in {@area area 14|67e|x}, taking 3 ({@dice 1d6}) de dany contundent.

entries.name: 16. Web-Filled Cave
entries: This 10-foot-high cave is filled with web cables. Tucked in the northernmost alcove, not visible from either cave entrance, is a rotting quaggoth that choked to death on a vrock demon's poison spores (see {@area area 17|683|x}). The dead quaggoth has no treasure.

entries.name: 17. Demons' Ledge
entries: Two ramps lead up to a 40-foot-high ledge that mostly encircles the walls of an immense, dark cavern. The ledge nearly surrounds the drow fortress. There are no gaps in the stone where the walls of the ledge meet the walls of the fortress.

Five {@creature Vrock||vrocks} are perched on the ledge, one each at locations {@area 17a|684} through {@area 17e|688}. These demons were summoned by Drivvin Freth, and they obey only his commands. The vrocks use their {@sense visió de foscor} to scan the cavern for intruders.

When a vrock sees something suspicious, it emits a loud screech that can be heard throughout areas 10 through 19, alerting all creatures in those locations. The demons then eagerly join any battle that erupts.

entries.name: 17a. Northeast Perch
entries: The {@creature vrock} perched here focuses its attention on the ramp leading up to this area.

entries.name: 17b. North Perch
entries: In addition to guarding this section of the ledge, the {@creature vrock} here watches for trouble in the east moss garden of area 18i, and listens for intruders in {@area areas 15|680|x} and {@area 16|682}. Web cables in the tunnels leading to those two locations prevent the vrock from exploring them.

entries.name: 17c. Northwest Perch
entries: The {@creature vrock} perched here is gnawing on a dead troglodita. It has fashioned a nest for itself from the bones of troglodita children snatched from the fungi gardens 30 feet below ({@area area 18i|699|x}).

entries.name: 17d. South Perch
entries: The {@creature vrock} here pays close attention to the entrance to the minotaure caves south of it. The main cavern is strung with web cables, with the tunnels beyond descending to {@area area 7b|65d|x}. The vrock is too large to move through the cables.

entries.name: 17e. Southeast Perch
entries: The {@creature vrock} stationed here keeps a close eye out for intruders moving west from {@area area 11|670|x}. Slumped against the back wall of a small cave behind it are the skeletal remains of an ettin that was killed by adventurers long before the drow fortress was built. Six gnome skulls hang from the skeletal ettin's loincloth.

entries.name: 18. Drow Fortress
entries: House Freth built its dark fortress in a 100-foot-high cavern, the roof of which is dotted with stalactites. Outside the fortress walls, the cavern floor is hidden under a 2-foot-thick layer of fog. The fog is absent inside the walls and around Spiderwatch Keep, the great edifice at the heart of the fortress ({@area area 19|69a|x}).
There are no light sources in or around the fortress. Anyone approaching with light draws the attention of the drow in the guard towers and the vrocks in {@area area 17|683|x}.

The north end of the fortress grounds is where the drow cultivate food using the labor of prisoners and thralls. The spacious area southeast of the keep is used for military drills, weapon practice, and assembling before expeditions.

entries.name: Fortress Defenses
entries: The 30-foot-tall outer walls and the 40-foot-high towers that stand along them are fashioned from smooth black stone. The tops of the walls are tapered and lined with 5-foot-tall stone spikes spaced 10 feet apart. The spikes have sticky webs strung between them like barbed wire to hinder creatures attempting to cross over. For the effects of sticky webs, see "{@book Dungeon Hazards|DMG|5|Dungeon Hazards}" in chapter 5 of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}. Each tower has a flat roof encircled by crenellated battlements. If an alarm is raised, the residents of the fortress mobilize quickly. Twenty drow emerge from the barracks in {@area areas 18e|693|x} and {@area 18f|694}, joining Rilna Freth (from {@area area 19c|69e|x}) and four drow elite warriors (from {@area area 19a|69b|x}). These drow take up defensive positions in the courtyard, spreading out to dilute the effect of area attacks. Against unusually strong foes, Rilna releases the prisoners in {@area areas 18g|695|x} and {@area 18h|697}, forcing them to fight for House Freth. But the moment the fight turns against the drow, the prisoners turn against their captors. In addition to the drow in the courtyard, invaders must contend with the drow in the guard towers, who can target creatures both inside and outside the courtyard. Each of the guard towers ({@area areas 18a|68b|x} through {@area 18d|691}) is utilitarian and unfurnished. A tower has the following features and defenses:

items: The tower's stone doors are reinforced and barred from the inside. Siege weapons are needed to break them down.
Arrow slits on the first and second floors provide three-quarters cover to those standing behind them. The rooftop battlements provide variable cover, depending on the angle of attack.

Iron ladders and trapdoors connect each level of a tower, and the trapdoor in the roof can be bolted shut from below. Breaking through a bolted trapdoor requires a successful DC 27 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check.

Each tower contains eight male drow (four on each of the first and second floors) who fire light crossbows through the arrow slits. This attack is the same as the drow's hand crossbow attack, except it has a range of 80/320 feet and deals 6 ({@dice 1d8 + 2}) de dany perforant.
A male drow mage stands watch on the rooftop.

Characters who have House Freth escorts or who wear clever drow disguises can approach the fortress openly. The mage atop the gate tower ({@area area 18a|68b|x}) demands to know who they are and why they have come, granting entry only if their answers raise no suspicions. As the visitors make their way through the tower, the drow mage summons a quasit and instructs it to notify Rilna Freth of the new arrivals. The quasit assumes bat form and flies to {@area area 19c|69e|x} to deliver the news. Rilna decides what to do with any visitors and leads those who seek an audience with her sister, Erelal, to {@area area 19k|6ad|x}.

entries.name: 18a. Gate Tower
entries: This tower serves as the primary entrance to the fortress. A male {@creature drow mage} named Llaxdorl Freth (Erelal's cousin) stands watch on the roof, and eight male {@creature drow} are on guard inside.

Characters brought to the fortress as prisoners are stripped of their weapons and spellcasting implements as they pass through the tower. They are then detained in the courtyard until Rilna Freth (see {@area area 19c|69e|x}) decides their fate. Prisoners with no obvious value to the drow are sent to the slave pens ({@area areas 18g|695|x} and {@area 18h|697}). Everyone else is brought to Erelal Freth in area 19k for further questioning.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Llaxdorl carries a spellbook bound in spider chitin that contains all the spells he has prepared, plus {@spell esprai de colors}, {@spell pressa}, i {@spell grimpat d'aranya}. Fastened to his robes is an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Freth (25 gp) and a spider silk pouch containing two blue spinels (500 gp each).

entries.name: 18b. Northeast Tower
entries: This tower has a male {@creature drow mage} named Ulvir Barrek'zorn on the roof and eight male {@creature drow} inside. In addition to defending the tower, these drow are responsible for quelling uprisings in the nearby slave pen ({@area area 18g|695|x}).

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Ulvir carries a black, leather-bound spellbook adorned with silver web filigree. It contains all the spells he has prepared, plus {@spell forma gasosa}, {@spell arma màgica}, i {@spell Riure Horrible de la Tasha}.

entries.name: 18c. Northwest Tower
entries: This tower has a male {@creature drow mage} named Vrebbeth Imphiz'zal on the roof and eight male {@creature drow} inside. In addition to defending the tower, these drow are responsible for quelling uprisings in the nearby slave pen ({@area area 18h|697|x}) and gardens ({@area area 18i|699|x}).

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Vrebbeth carries a spellbook bound in stitched grimlock flesh that contains all the spells he has prepared, plus {@spell pany arcà}, {@spell ràfega de vent}, i {@spell adormir}. Fastened to his robes is a bone scroll tube that holds a {@item spell pergamí} of {@spell Telequinesi}.

entries.name: 18d. South Tower
entries: This tower has a male {@creature drow mage} named Yrrlcheb Beltorzza on the roof and eight male {@creature drow} inside.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Yrrlcheb carries a spellbook bound in supple flumph hide that contains all the spells he has prepared, plus {@spell botar}, {@spell imatge mirall}, i {@spell encàrrec}. Fastened to his robes is a spider silk pouch holding 31 pp.

entries.name: 18e. South Barracks
entries: This 20-foot-high curved structure has a stone door with no lock. The building houses ten off-duty male {@creature drow} who are variously spending their idle hours sharpening and poisoning their weapons, eating, or meditating on curved stone benches spaced along the walls.

entries.name: 18f. North Barracks
entries: This building and its residents are identical to {@area area 18e|693|x}.

entries.name: 18g. Garden Slave Pen
entries: The foul stench of trogloditas is obvious to any characters who approach this 40-foot-square enclosure, which has 20-foot-high walls of smooth stone, an iron-barred gate, and a 5-foot-thick roof of sticky webs with five {@creature Giant Spider||giant spiders} atop it. The pen currently holds five adult {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas} and four troglodita children (Small noncombatants), as well as a {@creature minotaure} chained to the ground. The minotaure's horns have been sawed off, and prolonged exposure to the trogloditas' stench has rendered the minotaure immune to its effects.
The spiders attack anyone who tries to tear through the webs or free the slaves trapped in the pen.

Any creature that enters the webs or starts its turn in them is {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature can use its action to try to pull itself out of the webs, doing so with a successful DC 12 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) or Destresa ({@skill Acrobàcies}) check. Each 10-foot-square section of webs has AC 10, 10 hit points, vulnerability to fire, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and psychic damage.

The pen's sturdy iron gate is held shut with an {@spell pany arcà} spell that only drow (including drow characters) can ignore. Forcing it open requires a successful DC 25 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check.

entries.name: Prisoners
entries: The drow use the trogloditas to tend their gardens ({@area area 18i|699|x}). The minotaure is too violent to be enslaved, so the drow are starving it until it either capitulates or grows so weak that the trogloditas can kill and devour it. The minotaure is {@condition restrained} but can butt foes with its head instead of making gore attacks, dealing 11 ({@dice 2d6 + 4}) de dany contundent on a hit. Its thick chains require a successful DC 30 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check to break, or they can be attacked. The chains have AC 19, 30 hit points, resistance to fire and piercing damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

entries.name: 18h. Goblin Slave Pen
entries: This pen has the same features as {@area area 18g|695|x}, except that the stench of trogloditas is absent here, and there are no giant spiders on the web roof. The contents of the pen are as follows:
{@b Goblins}. Twelve armed but weary-looking {@creature Goblin||goblins} are gnawing on bones and resting on straw pallets.
{@b Refuse}. The pen is littered with the skulls and bones of gnoms de les profunditats and goblins, as well as a few drow who angered Erelal Freth.

The drow use these goblin slaves as laborers. Each goblin suffers from two levels of {@condition exhaust}. The goblins cower and beg for their lives when faced with possible harm. Despite their pitiable appearance, they can't be trusted and will do anything to survive, including betraying and eating their liberators.

entries.name: 18i. Gardens
entries: These earthen fields provide much of the food that feeds House Freth's forces in Undermountain. Edible moss is grown in the east garden, while the other two gardens contain rows of barrelstalks and bluecaps (see "{@area Fungi|236|x}").

Tending each garden are two adult {@creature Troglodita||trogloditas} and three troglodita children (Small noncombatants) that work under the watchful gaze of a male {@creature drow} overseer. The {@creature Vrock||vrocks} in {@area area 17b|685|x} and {@area 17c|686} swoop down and attack any slave that refuses to work or any creatures that threaten the overseer.

entries.name: 19. Spiderwatch Keep
entries: Fashioned from seamless black stone with veins of silver running through it, this windowless edifice bears a striking resemblance to a crouching spider. From here, Erelal Freth oversees all House Freth ventures in Undermountain, with her brother Drivvin as her advisor.

The central oval of the keep ({@area areas 19e|6a2|x} through {@area 19k|6ad}) has 15-foot-high walls and a 30-foot-high domed roof. The attached outer structures ({@area areas 19a|69b|x} through {@area 19d|6a1}) have 10-foot-high walls and 20-foot-high domed roofs.

All outer doors are held shut with {@spell pany arcà} spells that only drow wearing the obsidian insignia scarabs of House Freth can ignore. A successful DC 25 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check is needed to force open such a door. The inner doors have no locks.

When an alarm sounds outside, the occupants of the keep prepare for battle but remain where they are. They cannot be surprised, and any ability checks to convince residents that intruding characters are not a threat are made with disadvantage. This state of battle readiness is maintained until Rilna Freth tells occupants of the fortress that it is secure.

entries.name: 19a. Elite Barracks
entries: Four off-duty female {@creature Drow Elite Warrior||drow elite warriors} are stationed here: Ilanlue and Sabatrin Freth (the third and fifth of Erelal's seven daughters), Iymn Vrindolin, and Mircolar Do'ett. They spend their idle hours sharpening and poisoning their weapons, eating, sparring, or meditating on curved stone benches spaced along the walls.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Each warrior wears an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Freth (25 gp).

entries.name: 19b. Stores
entries: The stone door to this curved structure has an {@spell pany arcà} spell cast on it that only drow wearing the obsidian insignia scarabs of House Freth can ignore. This chamber contains stone shelves lined with provisions for the guards of the stronghold: two hundred spider silk packets, each containing 10 dies de racions (dry moss and mushrooms), and one hundred full water skins.

entries.name: 19c. Castellan's Quarters
entries: The stone door has an {@spell pany arcà} spell cast on it that only drow wearing the obsidian insignia scarabs of House Freth can ignore. These well-appointed quarters belong to the fortress castellan, Rilna Freth, a {@creature drow elite warrior} with 110 hit points, and the younger sister to Erelal Freth. This area has the following features:

{@b Hole}. A 2-foot-diameter hole is cut through the roof. The hole, 20 feet above the floor, allows quasits in bat form to deliver messages to Rilna from the gate tower ({@area area 18a|68b|x}). A Small creature can slip through the hole easily, and a Medium creature can do so with a successful DC 17 Destresa ({@skill Acrobàcies}) check.
{@b Cabinet}. A slender, glass-fronted cabinet made of black wood and inlaid with silver, web-like tracery stands across from the door.
{@b Hammock}. A spider silk hammock hangs to the west.
{@b Chest}. A padlocked iron chest to the east has a lid embossed with tiny spiders.
Rilna carries the key to the padlocked chest, or the lock can be picked una tirada de Destresa (CD 20) using thieves' tools.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: The chest contains 800 gp, six zircons (50 gp each), four garnets (100 gp each), a topaz (500 gp), and two {@item Poció de curació||potions of healing}.
The cabinet contains twenty flasks, each one holding five applications of {@item metzina de dróu} (see "{@book Poisons|DMG|8|Poisons}" in chapter 8 of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}).

Rilna wears a platinum helm shaped like a spider with eight jet orbs for eyes (2,500 gp) and a spider silk cloak (50 gp). Fastened to her cloak is an obsidian scarab engraved with the insignia of House Freth (25 gp).

entries.name: 19d. Armory
entries: The stone door has an {@spell pany arcà} spell cast on it that only drow wearing the obsidian insignia scarabs of House Freth can ignore. The back wall is lined with boxes arrayed on shelves. Inside these boxes are thirty shortswords, thirty hand crossbows, and several hundred hand crossbow bolts.

entries.name: 19e. Hall of Spiders
entries: This dark hallway crawls with hundreds of harmless spiders.

Visitors to the keep are led down the hall to {@area area 19k|6ad|x} to meet with Erelal and Drivvin. The footfalls of passersby alert the guests in area 19f, who emerge from their quarters to greet and assess new arrivals.

entries.name: 19f. Guest Bedroom

entries: {@b Emissaries}. Maleen Shadowdusk (CE female Illuskan human {@creature mage}) and Tendra Nightblade (CE female Illuskan human {@creature assassin}) dwell here.
{@b Furnishings}. The furnishings, made of zurkhwood, include a large bed with spider silk sheets and an armoire.
{@b Light}. A shuttered lantern with a {@spell foc perenne} spell cast on it hangs above the bed.

Maleen and Tendra have come from Shadowdusk Hold ({@adventure level 22|WDMM|22}) on the orders of Halaster Blackcloak. Under the guise of seeking an alliance between Shadowdusk Hold and House Freth, they have extended an offer to Drivvin Freth to become the Mad Mage's newest apprentice. Drivvin has told the two that he needs time to make his decision, and now the emissaries have grown anxious waiting for his answer.

Both emissaries show evidence of their (false) interest in currying favor with House Freth by coming to its defense if Spiderwatch Keep is attacked, but they flee the fortress if Erelal and Drivvin both fall in battle.

entries.name: 19g. Kitchen and Pantry
entries: The main room of this area is a kitchen, with counters and cupboards lining the outer wall. Two unarmed and unarmored male {@creature drow} named Elendar and Farril prepare meals here for the residents of the keep. {@spell Geas} spells regularly cast by Drivvin prevent the two cooks from poisoning the food or drink.
The smaller room east of the kitchen is a well-stocked pantry.

entries.name: 19h. Bath
entries: An iron tub stands in this area, with an iron pump nearby. The pump draws water from an underground hot spring beneath the fortress to fill the tub.
{@b Cape}. A long black cape with silver, web-like embroidery and a silver spider clasp hangs from a peg by the door.
{@b Furnishings}. An ornate zurkhwood lectern stands bare in the middle of the room. At the foot of the lectern sits an adamantine chest with spider-shaped handles.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: The cape hanging by the door is a splendid garment worth 250 gp.

The chest has an {@spell pany arcà} spell cast on it that only Drivvin can ignore. A {@spell picaporta} spell or similar magic opens the chest, which is otherwise impregnable. The chest's interior is divided into compartments and contains a pair of black leather boots, an empty water skin, a {@condition petrificat} basilisk egg, spider silk sack containing 175 pp, a {@item potion of vitality}, and two thick spellbooks.

The spellbooks contain all the spells Drivvin Freth has prepared, plus {@spell animar els morts}, {@spell animar objectes}, {@spell camp antimàgic}, {@spell pany arcà}, {@spell fabricar}, {@spell dit de la mort}, {@spell bola de foc}, {@spell geas}, {@spell globus d'invulnerabilitat}, {@spell raig d'afebliment}, {@spell grimpat d'aranya}, i {@spell moldejar la pedra}.

entries.name: 19j. Erelal's Sanctum
entries: Erelal uses this area to engage in numerous dark pleasures. The room contains the following:
{@b Prisoners}. Two male {@creature drow} hang suspended from manacled iron chains anchored to the curved outer wall. Two other sets of esposes hang empty.
{@b Cradle}. Against the south wall, between the two doors, is an ornate cradle carved with spiders and fitted with a protective web-like canopy.
{@b Table}. On a small table next to the cradle sits a small black casket. The table has a lower shelf with a ring of iron keys resting on it. (The keys unlock the esposes in this room.)
Both prisoners have been strung up to face the wall, their bare backs covered in blood from the cuts inflicted by Erelal Freth's scourge.

One of the prisoners is Hatchrin Alet'taz, consort of Erelal Freth and the father of her unborn eleventh child. He is unarmed and unarmored, and has 3 hit points remaining. Erelal is torturing him because she received a report that someone close to her was planning to poison her child after its birth, then found a vial of poison on his person. (The false report and the planting of the poison are both the work of Drivvin Freth, who wants to get Hatchrin out of his sister's life.) Hatchrin promises any service to characters who can help him regain Erelal's trust and thus enable him to see the birth of his child.

The other drow prisoner is a House Auvryndar spy named Varrn Telenna. He is unarmed and unarmored, and has 6 hit points remaining. Erelal has finished interrogating him, and Varrn is beyond caring whether he lives or dies. If he is set free, Varrn thanks the characters, praises Lolth for sparing his life, and plots his escape.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: The cradle is dressed in spider silk blankets. Six tiny jeweled spiders (250 gp each) hang from the cradle's canopy by silver threads.

The black casket is a false offering of fealty brought by the Shadowdusk emissaries. It is set with mother-of-pearl and emblazoned with a painted gold emblem of the Shadowdusk family: a lit torch with three trailing embers, turned upside down. The casket weighs 15 pounds and is worth 250 gp as an art object. Its purple velvet lining holds a gold music box worth 2,500 gp.

entries.name: 19k. Mother and Brother
entries: As the characters approach any of the doors to this area, they hear a female voice shouting in Èlfic, followed by a male voice's muted responses. Erelal Freth is chastising her brother Drivvin for his repeated failures to bring the minotaures of the southern caves under drow control. The western door has an {@spell pany arcà} spell cast on it that only drow wearing the obsidian scarab insignia of House Freth can ignore. The room's occupants and contents are as follows:

{@b Drow}. Erelal Freth, a pregnant {@creature drow priestess of Lolth}, reclines on a cushioned crystal divan of web-like design in the middle of the room. Two male {@creature drow} are attending Erelal while Drivvin Freth, a drow {@creature archmage}, paces angrily around the room.
{@b Cabinet}. A glass-fronted cabinet against the north wall contains a crystal decanter of mushroom wine and several varnished zurkhwood goblets.
{@b Shrine}. Against the east wall stands an impressive silver shrine to Lolth (see "Shrine of Lolth" below).

Erelal wears a flowing black and silver gown instead of armor, giving her AC 12, but is still armed with her scourge. The male drow with her are Chaszantar and Ulgreth, two sycophants vying to become her new consort. They both wear spider silk togas instead of armor, giving them AC 12.

Erelal is a mere thirty days away from giving birth to her eleventh child, but she refuses to let her pregnancy interfere with her work: the destruction of House Auvryndar and the conquest of Undermountain. A string of military defeats has left Erelal in no mood to entertain visitors, and her brother has yet to make good on his promise to enslave the minotaures of the Maze Level. Visitors who have business or grievances with Erelal are dealt with as quickly as possible. Those who come to her with frivolous affairs are scolded, threatened, and sent away with a stern warning not to trouble her again.

If she is threatened, Erelal tries to summon a {@creature yochlol} demon to defend her. If the shrine of Lolth in this chamber is intact, the demon summoning has a {@chance 90|90 percent} chance of success. Erelal then hinders her enemies with a {@spell darkness} spell before taking the safest exit. Giant spiders that she summons with the {@spell convocar animals} spell use their {@sense visió a cegues} to target enemies that are engulfed in magical darkness. If her defeat is inevitable and escape proves impossible, Erelal makes whatever concessions she must to save herself and her unborn child.

Erelal's older brother is clad in a long gray robe with black, web-like tracery. Drivvin has convinced his sister that he has the power to enslave the minotaures, which would enable House Freth to defeat the forces of House Auvryndar and secure its power in Undermountain. But, having realized that he can't summon a goristro demon alone, the archmage understands that accepting Halaster's offer and his promise of assistance is the only way his plan will succeed. Drivvin knows that if he leaves his sister to become Halaster's apprentice—even though that act is ultimately for her own gain—he will be cast out from his family. Drivvin is looking for the right time to break the news to his sister, whose recent defeats at the hands of House Auvryndar have made her despondent.
Drivvin is a drow {@creature archmage}, with these changes:

items: He is neutral evil.

He has these racial traits: He speaks Abyssal, Common, Nannès, Èlfic, Goblin, and Undercommon. Té avantatge a salvar contra la condició {@condition fascinat} i no pot patir son màgicament He has {@sense visió de foscor} out to a range of 120 feet. He can innately cast {@spell llums dansaires} at will, and can cast {@spell darkness}, {@spell foc follet}, i {@spell levitar} (self only) each once per day. His habilitat de llançament de conjurs is Carisma (spell save DC 15). he té desavantatge quan li toca llum solar, as well as a tirades d'habilitat de Saviesa ({@skill Percepció}) que involucrin la vista.
He has cast {@spell ment en blanc} on himself.

Once per day com a acció, Drivvin can summon a demon that has a challenge rating of 6 or lower. The summoned demon apareix en un espai desocupat within 60 feet of him, acts as his ally, and can't summon other demons. The summoned demon remains until Drivvin dismisses it as an action or until the demon is reduced to 0 hit points.

entries: If a fight breaks out here, Drivvin uses his first action in combat to cast {@spell deturar el temps}. He uses the extra time granted by the spell to summon a {@creature barlgura} and cast {@spell escut de foc} on himself, as well as {@spell armadura de mag} i {@spell pell de pedra} if he hasn't done so already. Drivvin fights to the finish to defend his sister.

entries.name: Shrine of Lolth
entries: This shrine resembles a 6-foot-tall cage of polished silver webbing with delicate hinged doors. The silver cage is fused to the wall and can't be detached from it. Inside the cage is a 3-foot-tall obsidian statue of Lolth in her drow form. The statue is smeared with sacrificial blood, and a blood-caked obsidian dagger rests at the statue's feet.

Any creature that removes the statue from the shrine immediately contracts a disease called slimy doom. The disease lasts for 7 days or until cured with a {@spell restabliment menor} spell or similar magic. A creature afflicted with slimy doom begins to bleed uncontrollably, and has disadvantage on Constitució checks and Constitució saving throws. In addition, whenever the creature takes damage, it is {@condition atordit} fins el final del seu proper torn.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Erelal wears a platinum web necklace with tiny black crystal spiders dangling from it (2,500 gp).
The statue of Lolth weighs 250 pounds and is worth 2,500 gp as an art object. The obsidian dagger at the shrine is worth 250 gp.
The delicate crystal decanter in the wine cabinet is worth 250 gp, but it shatters easily.
Drivvin wears an iron ring that serves as the control ring for the iron spider in {@area area 12b|677|x}.

entries.name: Aftermath
entries: If the characters fail to defeat Drivvin Freth, the drow archmage agrees to serve Halaster as an apprentice in exchange for the Mad Mage's help in summoning and binding a goristro. The summoning ritual takes 30 days to prepare, and it is performed by Drivvin and Halaster in the courtyard of the drow fortress.

When the demon appears, Halaster traps it in a 5,000 gp ruby and gives the gemstone to Drivvin. Under the cloak of an {@spell invisibility} spell, Drivvin takes the gem to {@area area 8a|661|x} and breaks it, releasing the goristro there. Mistaking the demon for an emissary of Baphomet, the minotaures watch as it devours the carrion in {@area area 8a|661|x}. When it has no more carrion to feed on, it begins devouring whatever it can kill. Once its hunger is satisfied, the demon sends its new minotaure lackeys to kill everything on {@adventure level 11|WDMM|11} and bring it more food to eat. The goristro considers any drow wearing the insignia of House Freth to be its ally, and orders its minotaures to go forth and slay all other creatures.

If Erelal Freth survives, she gives birth to her eighth daughter, Amalica, and continues to wage war against House Auvryndar and its allies. Amalica's birth is viewed as a sign of Lolth's favor, renewing House Freth's resolve and turning the tide in its favor. Several houses formerly allied with House Auvryndar switch sides and send emissaries to Erelal with gifts for her blessed newborn.

If Erelal and Drivvin perish, House Freth's allies abandon the house out of fear that Lolth has forsaken them. Without these allies, House Freth becomes too weak to defend itself against even its minotaure neighbors. The survivors hole up in the fortress while envoys are dispatched to the Underdark to secure reinforcements. Those reinforcements won't arrive in time if Vlonwelv Auvryndar (see {@adventure level 10|WDMM|10}) has her way.

data.name: Level 13: Trobriand's Graveyard
entries: Known as the Metal Mage, Trobriand specializes in the manufacture of metal constructs. This level serves as his workshop, testing ground, and junkyard. Trobriand himself is an infrequent visitor, preferring instead to remain close to his master, Halaster, on {@adventure level 23|WDMM|23}. Trobriand's Graveyard is designed for four 12th-level characters. Those who overcome this level's challenges should gain enough PX to reach 13th level.

entries.name: What Dwells Here?
entries: Trobriand's magical constructs populate this level. Among them lives a gnome named Zox Clammersham. Hobgoblins from {@adventure level 14|WDMM|14} sneak into Trobriand's Graveyard, eager to steal scrap metal for their fire giant overlords and also hoping to get their hands on the ring Zox uses to command many of the dungeon's constructs.

entries.name: Scaladar
entries: Foremost among the constructs that occupy Trobriand's Graveyard are the scaladar (see {@adventure appendix A|WDMM|25}). Resembling massive scorpions with crushing claws and electrified stingers, scaladar act autonomously until forced to obey the commands of a creature that wears one of Trobriand's metal control rings.

entries.name: Bore Worm
entries: Trobriand modeled this 100-foot-long, 15-foot-diameter drilling machine after a cuc lila. Unless Trobriand commands it to do otherwise, the {@creature Bore Worm|WDMM|worm} tirelessly moves through well-worn tunnels and trenches. It mindlessly attacks anything that gets in its way, and occasionally ventures up to {@adventure level 12|WDMM|12} or down to {@adventure level 14|WDMM|14}. Characters hear it long before they see it.
The {@creature Bore Worm|WDMM|worm} has a challenge rating of 16 (15,000 PX) and is a {@creature cuc lila}, with these changes:

items: The worm is a construct.
It has immunity to poison and psychic damage, as well as bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons.

It has immunity to {@condition exhaust} and the {@condition encegat}, {@condition fascinat}, {@condition eixordat}, {@condition acovardit}, {@condition paralitzat}, {@condition petrificat}, {@condition emmetzinat}, i {@condition enderrocat} conditions.
The worm regains 10 hit points a l'inici de cada torn seu si té 1 punt de vida com a mínim.
Replace its Multi-atac and Bite action options with the options described below.

entries.name: Multi-atac
entries: The worm fa dos atacs: one with its grinding jaws and one with its stinger.

entries.name: Grinding Jaws
entries: {@i Atac armat cos a cos}: +9 a impactar, 10 peus d'abast, un objectiu. {@i Hit}: 22 ({@dice 3d8 + 9}) de dany tallant.

entries.name: Zox Clammersham
entries: A clever rock gnome, Zox Clammersham is the sole survivor of his former party's failed Undermountain expedition. Since the demise of his friends, Zox has managed to secure a ring that allows him to command the scaladar. He has put the constructs to work building a device he calls the Simulacrux. This device will, in theory, create a simulacrum of any scaladar that passes through it. Zox's intentions are not malevolent; he simply needs more scaladar in order to build all the things he has it in his head to build.

entries.name: Hobgoblin Raiders
entries: The bounty of salvage on this level has not gone unnoticed by the fire giants on {@adventure level 14|WDMM|14}. They send hobgoblin minions to steal scrap metal, which the giants are using to build a great construct of their own. The hobgoblins raid in small bands, using trained rust monsters to distract Zox's constructs. These raiders are naturally violent but can be parlayed with by clever adventurers.

The hobgoblins recently figured out how Zox controls the scaladar, and now they aim to kill the gnome and take his control ring. So far, Zox has managed to elude all the hobgoblins sent to murder him.

entries.name: Exploring This Level
entries: All location descriptions for this level are keyed to map 13. Unless otherwise noted, tunnels connecting the various caverns have 30-foot ceilings.

entries.name: 1. Tunnels and Trenches
entries: Trobriand's bore worm created the tunnels that connect this level to {@adventure levels 12|WDMM|12} and {@adventure 14|WDMM|14}. The worm also dug 20-foot-deep trenches through {@area areas 2|6bd|x} and {@area 11|6ee} on this level. These tunnels and trenches have been worn smooth by the worm's repeated passage. Scaling a tunnel or a trench wall without magic or climbing gear requires a successful DC 20 Força ({@skill Atletisme}) check.

Arching bridges of stone span the trenches at three points. A character can try to leap off a bridge onto the bore worm's back as it passes underneath. Any character trying to do so must make una tirada de Destresa ({@skill Acrobàcies}) amb CD 15. On a successful check, the character lands on the worm's back without taking damage or falling {@condition enderrocat}. On a failed check, the character slips and falls off the worm, landing {@condition enderrocat} in the trench and taking 10 ({@dice 3d6}) de dany contundent from the fall.

entries.name: 2. Vast Cavern
entries: This 120-foot-high cavern is abuzz with activity.

entries.name: 2a. Simulacrux

entries: {@b Simulacrux}. A 20-foot-deep trench surrounds a 100-foot-tall, half-completed metal archway that rises from a bed of scrap metal.

{@b Builders}. Four {@creature scaladar|WDMM} (see {@adventure appendix A|WDMM|25}) are hauling new pieces of metal to the arch and attaching them to it. The cavern is dark aside from the intermittent light of welding sparks coming from the constructs' tail stingers.

{@b Arbalests}. A dozen arbalests (use {@creature quadrone} statistics) flit around the arch. Each arbalest resembles an oversized repeating crossbow with mechanical wings and four articulated metal legs.

Zox Clammersham is using the scaladar under his control to build the Simulacrux and to defend it, should it come under attack. The Simulacrux is designed to replicate scaladar through a variation of the {@spell simulacre} spell that uses rust as a component instead of snow. The arch is still months away from completion, and there's a good chance it won't function as intended. A character can ascertain the arch's purpose with a successful DC 30 Intel·ligència ({@skill Arcana}) check.

The Simulacrux is a Gargantuan object with AC 19, 400 hit points, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't made of adamantine. Destroying the arch all but dooms the project, since Zox lacks the resolve to start over.

The Simulacrux warps magic in its proximity. Any spell cast within 30 feet of the arch automatically triggers a wild magic surge, the effect of which is determined by rolling percentile dice and consulting the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table in the "Sorcerer" section in chapter 3 of the {@book Manual del Jugador|PHB}.
The scrap metal around the arch is terreny difícil for creatures other than scaladar.

entries.name: 2b. Hobgoblin Vanguard
entries: A {@creature hobgoblin captain} named Kurlog has led a force of seven {@creature Hobgoblin||hobgoblins} to this location. They are hunkered down behind scrap metal barricades sloppily arranged along the northwest ledge overlooking the trench.

The hobgoblins aim to draw out Zox Clammersham, defeat him, seize the ring he uses to control the scaladar, and return the ring to Doomcrown, the hobgoblin warlord on {@adventure level 14|WDMM|14}. Kurlog will accept reasonable aid to complete this mission. In particular, he could use help taking down the arbalests that guard the Simulacrux.

entries.name: 2c. Detritus

entries: {@b Wreckage}. This section of cavern is dotted with the remains of broken machines.
{@b Corpses}. Two ogres clad in iron armor lie dead among the metal detritus, their flesh pierced by dozens of metal crossbow bolts.
The ogres served the hobgoblins until they were shot dead by Zox's arbalests a few days ago.
{@b Metal Wasps}. Buzzing about the 50-foot-high cavern are five giant wasps made of metal (see "Metal Wasps").

{@b Discarded Junk}. Half-completed and destroyed metal contraptions, most rusted beyond repair, lay strewn across the floor. Hidden amid the wreckage are a couple discarded magic items (see "Treasure" below).

{@b Rust Monsters}. Three {@creature rust monster||rust monsters} gorge on the piles of scrap and are too distracted by the abundance of food to pose much of a threat. They fight only in self-defense.

entries.name: Metal Wasps
entries: The {@creature metal wasp|wdmm|metal wasps} are programmed to attack Medium humanoids; they ignore other creatures unless attacked by them. They are {@creature Giant Wasp||giant wasps}, with these changes:

items: The wasps are constructs with AC 16 (armadura natural), 24 hit points each, and {@sense visió de foscor} out to a range of 60 feet.

They have immunity to poison and psychic damage, as well as immunity to the {@condition fascinat}, {@condition acovardit}, {@condition paralitzat}, {@condition petrificat}, i {@condition emmetzinat} conditions.

entries.name: Tresor
entries: Scattered among the discarded machinery are a couple of salvageable inventions. You can add other inventions of your own design.
